loans.name: Grece

texts.en: Grece is a responsible mother of five children. She is a 50-year-old married lady living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She runs a stitching business from home. She is capable of convincing the customers and also listening to what they require in styling and designing. But she is falling short of resources to back fill her stock so the she is able to increase her profits for the betterment of the family and to better sustain the business for her family's future. Therefore, Grece applied for the loan so she will be able to fullfil her customers' and her family's needs. Grece thanks and pays regards to BRAC pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her stitching business.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида молодая женщина в возрасте 35 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Умида живет в сельской местности и занимается животноводством. Она покупает молодой скот и откормив его несколько месяцев перепродает за более высокую цену. Животноводством Умида начала заниматься еще в детстве. Ее отец тоже занимался животноводством и у него было небольшое стадо. Она помогала отцу ухаживать за скотом, давать корм, пасти. После замужества она решила самостоятельно заняться животноводством и на накопленные деньги она решила купить пару молодых бычков. Постепенно она смогла повысить свой товарооборот. Муж Умиды ездит в Россию по сезону и работает там штукатуром на частных стройках. Дети Умиды ходят в школу и в свободное от школы время помогают маме ухаживать за животными. Сама Умида днем подрабатывает кухонной рабочей в столовой. На данный момент у Умиды заканчивается корм для скота, а продать скот она не может из низкой цены. С этой проблемой она решила обратиться в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Умида хочет закупить корм на зиму для скота.
texts.en:
Umida is a young woman who lives in a rural area.  She is 35, married, and the mother of two children.  She is involved in animal husbandry; she buys young livestock, fattens her animals for a few months, and then resells them at a higher price.  She got involved in this activity when she was still a child as her father also worked in animal husbandry and had a small number of livestock.  Umida used to help her father with the farm animals; she fed them and sent them to graze.  After she got married, she decided to start her own animal husbandry business and she bought her first two young bulls with some money that she had saved.  Gradually, she was able to increase her turnover.

Umida's husband regularly goes to Russia and works there as a plasterer on private construction sites.  Umida's children are both in school but they also help their mom after school, when they have some free time.  Umida herself has a second occupation; she works as a kitchen assistant in a cafeteria during the day.  At the moment, she is out of animal feed and she can't sell her animals because prices are very low.  In order to solve this problem, she has decided to turn to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, for support.  She will use her loan to buy animal feed for her livestock for the winter.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her livestock for the winter.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза  доброжелательная и молодая женщина, ей 32 лет. Она замужем  и у неё трое детей. Шахноза  живет вместе со своей семьёй  в городе Истаравшан. Она занимается бизнесом. Она продает самодельные печки для обогрева дома на рынке. Всё что она зарабатывает, расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для другие более перспективные цели. 
Шахноза  хочет  увеличить свой оборот, так как спрос на её продукцию повышается. Но у неё не хватает денежных средств на другие потребности, для  этого она  обратился в ООО МДО Арванд. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a friendly young woman.  She is 32, married, and she has three children.  She lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan.  She is involved in retail business at the market; she sells free standing stoves to heat people's homes.  All the money that she makes goes to provide for her family and she is not in a position to save any money for any other long-term goal.

As she is receiving an increasing demand for her products, Shahnoza would like to boost her sales.   However, she doesn't have the financial resources necessary to do so, so for this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand.  She thanks them in advance for their support.

loans.use: to expand her stove selling business.

loans.name: Artemio Jose

texts.es:
Artemio José con 30 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos de 6 y 4 años, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Artemio se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 7 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Artemio es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito de S/.1000 el cuál lo canceló puntual.
texts.en:
Artemio José is 30 years old. He is married and lives in his own rustic home along with his wife and two young children ages 6 and 4. They live in the Pomahuaca district in Jaén province of Cajamarca, Perú.

He has very good personal and work-related references from area inhabitants, most of whom work in agriculture, business and raising livestock.

Artemio works in farming, specifically growing coffee. He has been doing this for 7 years. The loan he seeks will be used for farming, the application and use of pesticides and fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

This will help with the structure, appearance and productivity of his crop, as well as a timely harvest. As a result he'll have greater production, a higher quality product and consequently no trouble selling his product.

Artemio is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had a loan of S/.1000 which he paid off promptly.

loans.use: with farm-related work, the application and use of pesticides and fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Natali Hayde

texts.es: Natali es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años que vive en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella trabaja como obrera en una empresa de elaboración de quesos. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cerdos orgánicos para empezar su propio negocio de cría de cerdos orgánicos, actividad en la que tiene experiencia puesto que la aprendió de sus padres, no sólo para mejorar sus ingresos económicos sino también para eventualmente dejar de ser una trabajadora dependiente. En el futuro desea poder contar con mayor cantidad de ganado y le gustaría fundar una familia.
texts.en:
Natali is a hard-working 25 year-old woman who lives in a rural part of Lari, located in Arequipa. She works as an employee at a cheese manufacturer.

She is seeking this micro-loan to be able to buy organic pigs to start her own business raising organic pork. This is something she has experience doing because she learned it from her parents.

She wants to do this not only to improve her income, but also to eventually stop working for someone else. In the future she'd like to have more livestock, and she'd like to start a family.

loans.use: to buy organic pigs to start her own pig-raising business.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 45-year-old, Lebanese, married woman and a mother of five children, some of whom are still attending school. She lives with her husband who is the income provider.

Bassima states that living costs are becoming very expensive. This is the reason why she is in real need today of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., whose funds will be paid at once to cover her children's study fees.

Her first goal is to ensure a good educational level for her children.

loans.use: to cover her children's study fees.

loans.name: Hector Marcial

texts.es: Marcial tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil divorciado hace 30 años empezó a trabajar como empleado en una vulcanizadora tuvo que pasar mucho tiempo para que con sus escasos  ahorros  lograra  crear su propio negocio una pequeña vulcanizadora en la que trabaja  las 24 horas del día. El necesita el dinero para comprar una maquina re labradora de llantas obteniendo mayores ganancias por este servicio para poder pagar los gastos de alimentación, arriendo, vivienda.
texts.en: Marcial is 46 years old and divorced. Thirty years ago, he started to work as an employee. He had to wait for a long time until his scarce savings reached enough to open his own business, a small tire repair shop that runs 24 hours a day. He needs money to buy a tire repair machine. By getting better earnings through this service, he will be able to pay for food, lease, and housing.

loans.use: buy a tire repair machine

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a 40 year old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He raises goats to earn a living and supplements his earnings  growing crops. He has been able to increase his household income. He is responsible for looking after his children and dreams of building a permanent house but he is unable to achieve this due to inadequate finances. 

He will use the loan to buy more goats.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.
With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yusuf now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike for business purposes.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abanyamurava-Mbugangari Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. She has operated a tomatoe business for five years. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Jeannette is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. She is the president of ABANYAMURAVA-MBUGANGARI group and she shown in the photo holding papers and money.

Jeannette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more tomatoes. She will use the loan to earn more profits, reinvest for better financial stability, pay her children's school fees, pay medical insurance, and buy new clothes for her children. Jeannette hopes to earn enough money to buy a general store.

loans.use: to purchase  tomatoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single woman with four children who lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She has grown tea for ten years and it has helped her to meet daily needs for herself and the children. She also operates a retail shop to supplement her income. She has a small amount of capital but dreams of expanding her tea plantation to employ workers.  She requests a loan to buy more land.

loans.use: to buy more land.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Aziza is a single woman in her early 30's with two young children. She has run a general store for three years and works from 4 pm to mid-night daily. She is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Aziza's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock and has managed to successfully repay her loan. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing marvelous. She used the profit to take care of her children, to repay the loan, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items. She dreams of expanding her business.

Azziza will share this loan with her 2-member loan group TRUST; they hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a hardworking married entrepreneur with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He raises cattle to earn a living. He also earns supplementary income growing crops and was inspired to start six years ago so that he could increase his household income and educate his children.

He has dreams of building a permanent house and looks at himself as a leading cattle farmer but he is unable to achieve his dream due to inadequate finances. He will use the loan to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia used her previous loan to buy more crates of soda, salt, sugar, and other items to sell. She is a resident of Kamwenge, married, runs a retail shop, and farms. She is so grateful to Kiva for supporting her, she used the income to educate her children. She is a jolly and active woman and works every day of the week to maximize her sales. Her main hardships are competition from other traders and fluctuating prices. She has a vision of expanding her business into a wholesale shop to serve her customers' increasing demands.

Jalia is requesting a loan to buy rice, soap , sugar and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, soap , sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 62-year-old father of 6. He lives in the eastern province of Zambia with his wife who is a stay at home mother. Joseph is looking to grow his business by opening a new outlet in the town of Chipata to improve his family's standard of living.

Joseph was drafted into compulsory national service in 1978 at the age of 20. He worked hard and rose through the ranks while in the Zambia national services. Joseph is now retired and runs his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that he provides the service of sending and receiving money to people. Joseph believes that every customer should leave one of his outlets with a smile on their face and he works hard to make this happen.

Joseph requests a Kiva loan to purchase a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to serve customers at the new location. He is hopeful that the new outlet will help to increase his earnings so that he can provide better for his family.

Joseph's dream is to send two of his sons to university as they are currently in high school. He also dreams of owning his own car one day.

In this photo, Joseph poses with his grandson BJ.

loans.use: To purchase a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services at the new location he would like to set up

loans.name: Iganga Town View School

texts.en:
Joseph is the head teacher of Iganga Town View School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Iganga with 800 students. Iganga Town View School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Iganga Town View School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joseph ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jabel

texts.en:
Jabel is a thirty five year hardworking single man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He raises cattle and cuts timber. He works every day and started his two businesses to earn income and support his family.His clients are businessmen who slaughter cattle and sell in the butcher shops. His dream is to expand his farm by increasing the number of cows in the farm but his main challenge is bad weather and drought.

He needs a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Lawal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam and her family live in the Chouf area of Lebanon. She is 50 years old and lives with her brother and father since her mother passed away. Her father is a farmer and her brother works as a security officer in a private company. In order to help them cover the household's expenses, Ahlam decided to turn her hobby into a business 15 years ago. In fact, after learning embroidery from her mother, she started selling her products to clients who loved the detail in her work. Ahlam likes practicing embroidery during the day because it is relaxing.
She is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will be using the loan to buy the fabric she needs as well as some new embroidery equipment that she will be using for better quality products. She hopes this loan will allow her to sell more handicrafts, attract new clients and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy quantities of fabric and embroidery equipment

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is single hard working mother with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a beauty salon and earns income from hair plaiting along a busy street where her clients can easily locate her. She started this business to supplement her income.

Kevin lacks modern equipment to help her serve her customers quickly. She needs hair driers and shampoo and will use a loan to buy more hair braids and Jerry/oil for her salon during the Christmas season when demand is high.

loans.use: to buy more hair braids and Jerry/oil for her salon.

loans.name: Edrine

texts.en: Edrine is a single mother with2 children who lives in Kyenjoj-Uganda. She is in the business of selling cooked food and earns income to sustain herself and children, as a single parent. She has gained a lot from this business and acquired land to construct a house. She wants to expand her business into a well equipped hotel to attract customers. Edrine requests a loan to buy some plastic chairs and serving tables for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy some plastic chairs and serving  tables for the restaurant

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later period of the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income from his farm to provide employment to members of his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lupakisho

texts.en:
At 21 years old, Lupakisho is the breadwinner in a family of six. This has been the case since his father’s death when he was ten years old. His dream is to run his own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality. He is requesting his first Kiva loan to make this happen.

Lupakisho resides in a town called Blantyre in Malawi. Blantyre is the second largest city in Malawi after its capitol. This makes it an ideal location for an emerging entrepreneur, and he is looking to set up his business there. As a mobile money banking service agent, he will deal in the sending and receiving of money for those in his community.

Lupakisho has requested a 516,500 MWK loan with Kiva's field partner Zoona in order to buy a branded trolley with which he can run his business outside of one of the big shops in Blantyre. This loan will also enable him to purchase a web-enabled phone and provide the funds needed to serve customers.

Lupakisho is grateful for the opportunity to be funded on Kiva and start running his own business. Once his mobile money business grows, he will use the revenue generated to further his education and plow his knowledge back into his business and his community. He has an interest in computers, and he would like to eventually get an I.T. qualification. He loves working with people, and he would like to use his business to create employment opportunities for others.

Lupakisho thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in his endeavor.

loans.use: to buy a trolley and an internet-enabled phone to become a mobile money transfer agent.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alketa

texts.en:
This is Alketa and Artan, a couple in their late 20s with their two adorable children, 8 and 4. They are photographed in front of a house that needs serious renovations and improvements, because the kids have been in and out of hospitals due to sickness caused by cold and poor living conditions, according to Alketa. Despite the fact that they live in a village, they don't own any piece of land where they could practice some agriculture/livestock, but plant only for themselves in the yard and keep some chickens as well.

Alketa works in a shoe factory not far from her home for a monthly pay of $171 and her husband does labour for $10/day. "We live under very poor conditions. It's not that we don't try, we do, but there are no jobs or better pay. Can you imagine working all day and earning ten dollars a day and never exceeding $700/year? Well, my husband does that, because we do need to survive," said Alketa during the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to do some repairs to the house seen in the background so that the kids don't get sick often as they do now because they are extremely poor.

loans.name: Kande

texts.en:
Kande is a Babban Gona maize farmer. She is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing her dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Kande would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, she can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Kande has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Kande is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having had no money to increase her farmland and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sizalobuhle

texts.en:
Sizalobuhle is a 38-year-old mother of two girls, aged 17 and 12. She works hard to support her daughters and wants to ensure they have a bright future. She wants to open a hair salon in the hopes that she will be able to have a stable income and create employment for others.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy equipment, such as dryers, chairs, mirrors, and tables as well as other salon accessories, such as oil and beauty kits. With this loan, Sizalobuhle will be able to start her salon and build a sustainable business, so that she can better provide for her daughters.

Sizalobuhle is a bright entrepreneur and she already has plans to target high-density areas by opening more salons in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a heavy-duty dryer, chairs, mirrors, tables, a hand dryer, and other salon accessories.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn is a farmer living in a rural area of Battambang province. She is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who are under the age for school. She has struggled for a living via growing rice for 10 years. Due to not having enough working capital to support her farming business, she is now leading a group of two members to apply for a loan via VisionFund.

This will be the sixth loan cycle for her while it is the first loan cycle for the other one in her group. With the previous loans, she could afford to buy enough consumables to support her family’s needs. As the leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy organic fertilizer to grow her crop well and the remaining money will be spent on buying chickens to raise. She hopes to gain more returns so as to send her beloved young children to attend school and be able to renovate her old house.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to grow her crop well so as to gain more income to send her beloved young children to attend school and be able to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Asiye

texts.en:
Asiye is married and a mother of two. She is doing a natural agriculture business, breeding chickens and hens and producing honey. She used a loan one time. She bought jars for her honey, and bait for her chickens. She made money by selling eggs and honey. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bait and an incubator. She wants to grow chickens and eggs and develop her bees. Her aim is to expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Asiye hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Asiye hanım doğal tarım ürünleri işi yapıyor civciv, yumurta, tavuk, ve bal üretimi yapıyor. Bir kez mikro kredi kullandı civciv ve tavuk yemi aldı. Balları için kavanoz aldı. Yumurta ve ballarını satarak para kazandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile tavuk yemi ve civciv makinesi alacak. Yumurta ve civciv yetiştirmek ve arılarını da geliştirmek istiyor. Hedefi işlerini geliştirmek.

loans.use: to buy bait and an incubator.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 67 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Adelaida has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to pay for rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Adelaida has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is a young guy who is 30 years old and is a married man with two children. He looks at himself as a young ‎and ‎persistent fighter. Zaid works in two fields. For the first one, he has a haberdashery shop and he collects the ‎haberdashery ‎through a small van that he owns. He also owns three horses and he rents them to people for ‎the holidays and occasions, and after the end of the season he works on plowing rugged agricultural land that the modern ‎tractors ‎cannot reach.‎‏ ‏The horses are also used in the filming of serials in Jordan, where he has a lot of experience in this field and has good ‎relations with the local directors.‎

This is his second loan after repaying the previous loan that he used to buy the third horse successfully. Zaid ‎is now applying for another loan to buy a new horse since he found this is good work and he is getting a good income, so he ‎wants to expand it and increase his income to provide a better life for his children.‎

loans.use: To buy a horse and work with it for plowing land until the filmmaker asks him to appear in another series with his horses.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, who is in her mid 40s, is married with six children. Two of them are still in school and four are grown up. She has been selling crafts for twenty-two years now. She works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Paulina’s twenty-first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the crafts stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loans. She used the profit to pay school fees for her kids, to repay the loans, bought a plot of land, built her own house, bought a TV set, a radio, cupboards, beds, mattresses, a sofa set and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best selling crafts to meet her customers' requirements.

She dreams of owning a hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy the best selling crafts to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Abdukhakim

texts.ru: Абдухаким жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Абдухаким является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом и бараном . Бизнес животноводства приносит Абдухаким хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Абдухаким обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Абдухаким заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdukhakim is a 43-year-old-man with a positive attitude in life.  He is married and the father of two children.  He lives with his close-knit family in a rural area.  Every member of the family tries to make money to bring an income home.  Everyone does what he/she can. Abdukhakim's main and most stable activity is animal husbandry.  He raises and sells livestock.  His wife helps him; she takes care of the sheep and other livestock.  Thanks to animal husbandry, Abdukhakim makes a good and stable income, which is the reason why he would like to expand his activity.

Abdukhakim needs to buy a few additional head of livestock to raise and resell.  With this goal in mind, he has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan to buy livestock.  He hopes to be able to successfully grow his business and increase his income, so that he can adequately meet the needs of his family.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a few head of livestock.

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.ru: 26 летный Сарвар из района Бохтар. Сарвар живет вместе с родителем. Он образованный парень. Он раньше работал учителем в школе. Сейчас он занимается таксистом. Сарвар два года назад начал работать таксистом. Потому что с заработной платы учителя  он не смог обеспечить семью. Сарвар до сегодняшнего дня перевозить людей и зарабатывает на жизнь. У Сарвар есть маленькая проблема с двигателем автомашин. Для восстановления автомашин ему нужно купить запчасти. Сарвар  просит кредит для купли авто запчасти. Ему очень нужно поддержка. Вы можете поддержать его!
texts.en:
26-year-old Sarvar is from Bohtar region. Sarvar lives together with his parents. He is an educated chap. Before, he worked as a schoolteacher. Now he is a taxi driver. Sarvar started working as a taxi driver two years ago, because he could not support his family with his schoolteacher's wages. To this day, Sarvar drives people around and earns a living. 

Sarvar has a small problem with his car's engine. In order to repair his car, he needs to buy spare parts. Sarvar is asking for a loan in order to buy spare car parts. He really needs support. You can help to support him!

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар 30 лет. Она очень добрая и заботливая мама. Ее сыну 4 года. Санавбар живет с мужем, сыном и свекровью. Она швея. Этим она помогает своему мужу. Санавбар хочет устроить мероприятие по случаю обрезания ее сына. Она ждала этого очень долго. И поэтому они с мужем хотят очень хорошо провести это празднование. За помощью Санавбар обращается к Вам. Ей необходима определенная сумма. Заранее Санавбар выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Sanavbar is 30 and a very kind and caring mother of a four-year-old son. She lives with her husband, son and mother-in-law. She is a seamstress and helps her husband with her sewing. 

Sanavbar wants to put on a party to celebrate her son's circumcision. She has waited for this a long time and, therefore, she and her husband want to do a good job with the event. She is turning to you for help as she needs this amount of money. She expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to put on a party for her son's circumcision

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl con 34 años de edad,vive en casa propia de material rústico de un piso,junto a su madre, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú,en una zona rural.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 hectáreas de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación esta en segundo año de producción, tiene cuatro años de edad,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 5 años. Adiconalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, viticas, menestras y otros. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1,5 hectáreas de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Raúl es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firmará sólo.
texts.en:
Raúl, 34 years old, lives in a one-story, rustic material house of his own with his mother in the district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca in the country of Peru, in a rural area. He has very good personal as well as work references by the inhabitants of the area. The people of this town work mostly in agriculture, trade, and stockbreeding.

Raúl makes a living in farming, specifically in the cultivation of coffee, having to date 1.5 hectares of the Catimor variety, resistant to diseases and pests. The plantation is in its second year of production; it is four years old. Raúl has an experience in this line of work of over 5 years. Additionally, he makes a living raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and growing staple food crops (cassava, plantains, chia seeds, lentils, and others). The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the maintenance and cultivation of 1.5 hectares of coffee in production, ensuring a good production for the 2015 market, reflected in a higher volume of sales and thus get higher revenues in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Raúl is a recurrent partner of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing alone.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance and cultivation of 1.5 hectares of coffee in production.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a mother of five children whom she adores and cherishes. 

For the last five years, she has earned a living largely by mixed farming. She is very experienced at growing maize and raising sheep, which she enjoys doing. Although Miriam has been making profits, life is not easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing as large a harvest as it could because of a lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seeds so she can expand her farm. 

She believes that this loan will ensure a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. It will also allow her to expand her horticulture business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and seeds.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ishaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ishaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ishaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ishaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hauwa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hauwa can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hauwa is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saminu

texts.en:
Saminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saminu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Saminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Saminu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Saminu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Margret has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Margret would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Margret can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Margret will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Margret is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо очень благодарна за Вашу помощь и отзывчивость, которую вы оказали в прошлый раз. Благодаря вашей поддержке её дочь продолжает учиться. Дочь Дилрабо очень старательная и учится на отлично. Она старается быть опорой своей маме, которая ради своих детей готова на все. И на сей раз Дилрабо хочет получить кредит, чтобы оплатит за ученический контракт дочери. Она надеется только на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Dilrabo is very grateful for your help and compassion that helped her last time. Thanks to your support her daughter is able to continue to study. Dilrabo's daughter is very diligent and gets good grades. Her daughter tries to support her mother, who is ready to do anything for her children. This time, Dilrabo wants a loan to pay for her daughter's tuition. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's medical school education

loans.name: Shosanam

texts.ru: Шосанам благодарит за предыдущий кредит. Она смогла значительно продвинуть свой бизнес. Но она не будет стоять на одном месте и хочет дальше идти. Теперь Шосанам тоже просит кредит для приобретения машины. Машину будет водить ее муж. Он будет привозить товар для продажи. Шосанам надеется, что в этот раз ее тоже поддержат.
texts.en: Shosanam is grateful for her previous loan and was able to significantly advance her business. However, she does not want to stay in one place and would like to move forward. Now Shosanam is asking for a loan to purchase a car, which her husband will drive to transport the goods that she will sell. Shosanam hopes that you will also support her this time.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport goods

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru:
Манучехр молодой и начинающий бизнесмен из района Фархор. Ему 25 лет. Он также отец двоих маленьких детей. Манучехр после рождения детей начал к жизни относится гораздо серьезнее и уже думает не только о себе, но и о своей жене и ребенке. Он несет ответственность за свою семью. 
На данный момент Манучехр безработный, так как это долго не может продолжаться, он не стал дожидаться и Манучехр принял решение начать собственный бизнес. Он будет заниматься животноводством. В Таджикистане прекрасный климат, для животноводческой деятельности способствующий к здоровому росту и развитию животных. Для начала бизнеса Манучехру нужны инвестиции. Он надеется, что с кредитом он сможет и начать деятельность.
texts.en:
Manuchehr is an aspiring young businessman from the Farkhor district. He is 25 and a father of two young children. Manuchehr began to take life more seriously after the birth of his children and does not think only of himself, but also about his wife and children. He is responsible for his family.

Manuchehr is currently unemployed, which cannot continue. He didn't want to wait so he decided to start his own business raising livestock. Tajikistan has a wonderful climate for livestock that is advantageous for their health and development. Manouchehr needs investments to start his business and he hopes that the loan will help him start working.

loans.use: to start a livestock business

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста трудолюбивая и сильная женщина из Явана. В свои 54 года она со своим мужем занимается сложной работой — разведением скота. Двоих своих сыновей Гулдаста отправила в Россию на заработки. Младший сын помогает по хозяйству. Даже при наличии хорошего дохода Гулдаста нуждается в кредите для покупки породистого скота. К сожалению, для покупки хороших животных нужны хорошие средства. Поэтому Гулдаста просит Вас помочь ей приобрести этих животных.
texts.en: Guldasta is a strong, hardworking woman from Yavan. At age 54 she and her husband do the difficult work of breeding livestock. Guldasta sent two of her sons to Russia to work and the youngest helps out on the farm. Even with a good income, Guldasta needs a loan to buy purebred livestock. Unfortunately a good amount of money is required to buy good animals and Guldasta asks for your help.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Salimakan

texts.ru: Салимакан, 61 год, замужем, есть сын. У Салимакан - среднее образование, вместе с мужем она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Салимакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Салимакан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Салимакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Salimakan is 61, married, and has a son. She has a high school education and raises livestock with her husband. Thanks to Salimakan's hard work, she currently has two cows and five sheep. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Samaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth some day. 

Traditionally, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Samaila can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Samaila has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Samaila is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар, 33 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством, выращивая кукурузу на 0,60 ГА собственной земли. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 10 овец, 2 лошади. Продукция пользуется большим спросом. Ежемесячная прибыль - 19,000 сом (KGS). Нилуфар решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и удоя экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Нилуфар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nilufar is 33, married, and a mother of three. She has a high school education and earns the main income for her family by planting corn on a 0.6 hectare plot of her own land. She has five cows, ten sheep, and two horses. Her products are in great demand and she earns 19,000 som (KGS) per month. Nilufar decided to apply for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy two dairy cows to increase her livestock headcount and organic milk sales. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase her sales of organic milk

loans.name: Mujer Trabajadora Group

texts.en:
The Department (state) of Huehuetenango is located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The area shares a border with Mexico to the north and the west. The climate varies, ranging from tropical lowland forests, where temperatures are hot and the air is humid, to majestic mountains where the temperature plummets below freezing. In this place we found the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group “Mujer Trabajadora” (or “Hardworking Women”), formed by 10 women who share the common goal of creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. 

The ladies of this group want to see their children go to school and have the tools they need to have successful lives. The women have various businesses that include the sale of snacks and lunches, as well as tortillas made and sold three times daily from a small tortilla shop called a 'tortilleria'.  Another lady has a bakery and offers delicious breads and other baked items for sale. Still another woman sells shoes.

The President of the Trust Bank is Amelia, who is 49 years old. She studied until the fifth grade. Her lack of formal education has not stopped this hardworking, divorced mother of three children. She has a lunch sales business that is doing well. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, corn, beans, oil and other ingredients to make her tasty lunches.

The “Microcredit Plus Program" of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and educational training is of great benefit to Amelia and the ladies in the Trust Bank. At their monthly meetings, a Facilitator from the organization shares relevant and useful knowledge with the women about effective business.

Kiva investors are highly valued by Amelia and the ladies in the Trust Bank. It would be impossible for them to walk into a bank to secure a loan. Thank you, Kiva investors, for your kindness and generosity in funding these much-needed loans!

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans, oil and other ingredients to make her tasty lunches.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es un hombre de 25 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva.
Él es emprendedor, optimista y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Huarina’ ubicado a 62 kilómetros de la ciudad y situado a orillas del lago sagrado ‘Titicaca’, los pobladores se dedica a la pesca y agricultura mayormente.
Gilberto es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia que cuenta con energía eléctrica no cuenta con agua ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva como, pantalones, chaquetas, poleras, camisetas y otros, “trabajamos en este negocio desde mi anterior generación…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor en otras ciudades y comunidades, la desventaja es que tiene que viajar largas distancias para poder vender su producción. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprar más máquinas, el desea comprar tela por rollo. Eta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gilberto solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar ropa deportiva y venderla en el altiplano.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a 25-year-old man, married, he has 2 daughters of 2 and 4 years of age, and his business is the manufacture of sportswear.

He is entrepreneurial, optimistic and very hardworking. His business is conducted in the town of 'Huarina,' located 62 kilometers from the city and situated on the sacred banks of 'Titicaca.' The villagers mostly make a living in fishing and agriculture.

Gilberto is swarthy, with a short stature and sturdy physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in the region, and he speaks Spanish, which is spoken by the broader culture and for conducting business.

He shares his life with his wife, who makes a living in the same business, and with their children, who study in school. They live in their own house that has electrical energy but no water nor sewage.

His business is the manufacture of sportswear such as pants, jackets, sweatshirts, shirts and others. "We work together in this business since my prior generation..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he sells wholesale in other cities and communities, the disadvantage is that he has to travel long distances in order to be able to sell his production.

His dream is to improve his business and to purchase more machines, he desires to purchase fabric by the roll. His is the second land with the institution in three years that he conducts this trade.

For these reasons, Gilberto requests a loan in order to purchase fabric by the roll to make sportswear and sell it in the highlands.

loans.use: to purchase fabric by the roll to make and sell sportswear in the highlands.

loans.name: Vilma Idalia

texts.es:
Vilma, de 35 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también se dedica a la venta de pupusa y atol en el punto de buses; ella creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y a la venta de productos básicos, ella estudio hasta octavo grado, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  

Vilma, tiene 5 años de experiencia en el negocio de venta de pupusas y atol, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, quien siempre se dedicó a vender este tipo de productos.

Vilma, necesita el préstamo para comprar una mesa, una plancha para cocinar y comprar utensilios para la cocina, porque con los que cuenta están deteriorados y es urgente cambiar los utensilios, dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorarán sus ingresos económicos.

Vilma, sueña con mejorar las instalaciones de su venta de comida, algo que le permita instalar mesas para que las personas puedan consumir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old. She is a homemaker and she also sells pupusas and atol at the bus terminal. She was raised by her parents who worked in agriculture and selling staple products. She went to school up to the eighth grade, and she is a single mother of two children.

Vilma has 5 years' experience selling pupusas and atol. She learned this activity from her mother, who always sold these products.

Vilma needs the loan to buy a table, a cooking press, and kitchen utensils. The ones she has have deteriorated and she urgently needs new utensils. She will give her customers a better service and her income will improve.

Vilma dreams of improving the space where she sells her food, which will allow her to put in tables so people can eat comfortably.

loans.use: to buy a table, a cooking press and to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ali has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ali can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ali will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ali is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Estrellas De Xejip Group

texts.en:
In rural Quiche, in the western highlands of Guatemala, we find the area of San Antonio Ilotenango, home to the 10 ladies of “Estrellas de Xejíp”, or “Stars of Xejíp” Trust Bank. Living among forests full of fresh pine trees and mountains of rich soil, most of these women grow corn and raise animals such as pigs and hens on their rural properties. Others sell clothing and other products in the Quiché market, or run convenience stores in their community.

Agustina is 22 years old, and studied through to sixth grade. Four years ago, her husband left to work in the United States but she stayed in Xejíp, taking care of their little boy, who is now five years old, on her own. Agustina runs a small convenience store, selling basic, everyday products such as rice, beans, sugar, fruit juices, sodas and snacks. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in product sfor her store, including soda, sugar, and all the different foods and items she needs to replenish her inventory. 

In her first cycle with Friendship Bridge, this strong, intelligent, and determined woman is excited to see the growth that will come with her investment in micro-loans.

With a wide age range, from 22 to 70 years old, all of these ladies are in different walks of life, but what unites them is their shared motivation to improve their lives through investment in and expansion of their businesses. The majority move forward with the support of their spouses, providing education to their children (which number between one and 11). The value of education is important for each of these ladies, as many of them did not receive an education themselves.

loans.use: to invest in products for her store, including soda, sugar, and all the different foods and items she needs to replenish her inventory.

loans.name: Salmo 53 Group

texts.en:
The busy town of San Francisco El Alto, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala,  is built on the side of a large mountainside. It is a huge commercial center for the sale of handicrafts, textiles and animals. 

With access to the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and education, the 12 women who form the Trust Bank “Salmo 53”  in San Francisco El Alto are taking steps to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. These women are taking advantage of the large market in town to sell food and clothing items, including sweaters.

Ana is a member of the Trust Bank who needs to work very hard since she has seven children. She was able to have six years of formal education. Traditionally, Ana has had a textile business selling fabric for pants, and because she has been successful with this, she recently began a food business selling snacks and pre-prepared food items, too. She works on her new business with her husband. 

Ana is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her new food business, a potato cutting machine, a coffee pot, and kitchen utensils. Along with the other members of the group, Ana wants to take advantage of increased business during the final months of the year.

Ana and her friends in the “Salmo 53” Trust Bank are all requesting loans to invest in their small businesses. They are very united, responsible and motivated. At their monthly meetings, the ladies participate in educational trainings designed by a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. 

Kiva investors are valued collaborators in this effort. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her new food business, a potato cutting machine, a coffee pot, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira con 56 años de edad,de estado civil casada, vive en casa propia,junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores,como lo son el ganado caprino, porcino, cuyes y aves de corral,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 10 años. Elvira cuenta con 6 potreros en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar todos su potreros ya que aun no cuentan con techos y quiere minimizar riesgos por el tema del fenómeno del niño, de esta manera quiere prevenir daños colaterales en su negocio.

Elvira es socio recurrente para Epyme Alternativa, con un crédito anterior de S/.3000 cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old. She is married and she lives in her own home with her husband and three children in the district Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru, in a rural area. She has very good personal and work references from the area residents. The residents mainly work in agriculture and ranching.

She raises and sells small animals, such as goats, pigs, guinea pigs and poultry. She has more than 10 years' experience in this type of work. Elvira has six pens behind her home. She is asking for the improve all of her pens because they don't have roofs and she wants to minimize risk from the El Niño weather phenomenon and prevent collateral damage to her business.

Elvira is a recurring member of Epyme Alternativa, with a previous loan S/.3000, which she paid off on time.

loans.use: to improve her pens because they have no roofs and she wants to minimize the risks of the El Niño weather phenomenon.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, tiene la edad  de 47  años, casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en su bienestar y cumplir con algunas metas personales y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ronald is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and their children, who are his priority. With the loan, he plans to buy good quality, high germination bean seeds, fertilizer and other products to apply to his crop, as well as pay for the labor costs to apply them and tend to it once it has developed. This way, he can ensure that he is doing a good job. What he intends is to take advantage of the good weather and soil for this crop in the area. He also wants to put his years of experience of handling basic grains into practice. In addition, he wants to be able to buy the best products so his crop will develop well and be healthy, ensuring a good harvest and an important product in the short term. He hopes to be able to use the income from the harvest for his well being and to meet some personal goals and continue investing in the crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with more ease of payment and much lower interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso con 25 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Narciso se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Narciso es socio recurrente.Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Narciso, 25 years old, lives in his own house made of rustic material with his wife and children, in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the people in the zone. The inhabitants in this area work primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

Narciso works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with 6 years of experience in the field. The loan that will be granted to him will be used in agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and paying labor costs for his harvest. In this way, it will help him with the physiological, morphological and productive improvement of his crop, and also he will have a good harvest, and in the end will have more production and a better quality of product, so he won't have any problems in selling his product.

Narciso is a returning borrower. He will co-sign with his spouse.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor costs for the harvest.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 57 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, fuerte y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ caracterizada por el comercio informal y por realizarse la feria del mismo nombre, donde –se dice- se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta un camión.
Luisa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que trabaja como maestro constructor y con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. su negocio es la venta de comida como, ‘thimpo’ que se cocina a base de  Carne de cordero considerando una presa por persona, Un poco de cebolla, Papas cocidas, chuño pelado,  Arroz, Ají amarillo y orégano desmenuzado, “cocino puros platos tradicionales porque es lo aprendí a cocinar desde muy niña…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ubica en un sector industrial dónde existen muchos obreros que son sus clientes, la desventaja es que no cuenta con ayudante de cocina. Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos abriendo un restaurante, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina como, aceite, arroz, fideo, carne, verduras y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luisa solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar todos los días.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 57-year-old woman, married, and has an 18-year-old son, and her business is selling food.

She is independent, strong and very hard-working. Her business is in the 16 de julio zone, characterized by informal commerce and by having the market of the same name where, they say, one can find everything from a needle to a truck.

Luisa is dark-skinned, has long braided black hair and dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the business she does. She has her life in the company of her husband who works as a master builder and of her son who goes to school and works. They live in a house owned by the family, built of adobe, which has drinking water, electricity, and sewer services. Her business is selling food such as thimpo, which is cooked with a base of lamb meat, considered prey for people, a little onion, cooked potatoes, peeled freeze-dried potatoes, rice, yellow chili pepper and crumbled oregano. "I only cook traditional dishes because I learned to cook when I was very young..." she says. Her dream is to increase her income, opening a restaurant. She wants to purchase cooking supplies such as oil, rice, noodles, meat, vegetables, and more. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years that she has done this work.

For these reasons, Luisa asks for a loan to purchase cooking supplies to cook every day.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies to cook every day.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Lorena vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos dos niñas de 7 y 3 años y un  varón de 2 años de edad en la vivienda de sus padres. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y hortalizas, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar y brindar una alimentación saludable a su familia. Lorena desea contar con una vivienda, propia es por ello que ha decidido solicitar a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de un terreno para construir su vivienda propia lo antes posible para lo cual espera contar con este apoyo.
texts.en: Lorena is 22 years old. She lives in her parents' house with her life partner and three children (two daughters aged 7 and 3 and one son aged 2). She is a young and enterprising woman who grows basic grains and vegetables. This allows her to sustain her family's economy and provide them with healthy food. Lorena wants to have her own home and has therefore decided to ask FUSAI for a loan in order to invest in a plot of land where she can build this home as soon as possible. She hopes she can count on this support in order to build her home.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build her own home and offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.name: Francisca Esperanza

texts.es:
Francisca, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en un taller de carpintería, tiene dos hijos que trabajan para tener sus propios ingresos y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Francisca, tiene una venta de medicina y de huevos, desde hace 1 año comenzó a vender estos productos y este trabajo lo aprendió gracias su hermana; su trabajo lo realiza en toda la comunidad y su horario es desde 7:30 a.m. hasta que termina de visitar a todos sus clientes.

Francisca, necesita el préstamo para comprar más medicina para comenzar nueva venta, el préstamo le ayudará a mejorar su situación económica.

Francisca, sueña con colocar una tienda con variedad de productos y así incrementar sus ingresos y además desea que sus hijos puedan apoyarla económicamente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 41 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade, is married, and her husband works in a carpentry shop. She has two children who work to have their own income and only one of them lives with her.

Francisca sells medicine and eggs, she began to sell those products 1 year ago and she learned this work thanks to her sister. She does her work all over the community and her schedule is from 7:30 am until she finishes visiting all her customers.

Francisca needs the loan to purchase more medicines to begin a new sale, the loan will allow her to improve her economic situation.

Francisca dreams of establishing a store with a variety of products and, so, to increase her income an din addition she wants her children to be able to support her economically.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to begin a new sale.

loans.name: Rutalia Dilma

texts.es: Rutalia es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura cultivando diferentes hortalizas, con dicha siembra ella logra contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz. Rutilia vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 16, 4 y 2 años de edad, a los que ha sacado adelante como madre soltera. Rutalia desea cancelar gastos de escrituración, para tener la seguridad de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo anterior solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en pagos de derecho de escrituración y así brindar mayor seguridad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rutalia is a working woman who works in agriculture. She cultivates different crops and with this harvest she is able to cover the expenses of her home, which makes her feel very happy. Rutalia lives together with her three children who are 16, 4 and 2 years old, who she has helped to succeed as a single mother. Rutalia desires to cancel the debt for her deed in order to secure her home, but she does not have enough economic liquidity. Because of this, she is seeking a FUSAI loan to invest in deed payments in order to provide a more secure life for her children.

loans.use: to invest in deed payments in order to provide a more secure life for her children.

loans.name: Cerly María

texts.es: Cerly María, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está divorciada,  vive con su hijo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa para la venta a clientes de la comunidad y a su alrededor, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso personal y todos de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para él y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Cerly María is 29 years old, divorced and lives with her son, who is her first priority. With her loan, she will buy clothing to sell to customers in her community and the surrounding areas. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers a larger quantity of merchandise of good quality. With this purchase, she plans to earn a better income so that she can invest in her business and achieve her future goals for improving her and her family's quality of life.

This is the first loan that Cerly María has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Solomon is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Solomon would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.
