With Babban Gona’s support, Solomon will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Solomon now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zakariya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Zakariya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Zakariya will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Zakariya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to buy land

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She is married and has four children and she has a kale garden where many people come to buy every day. She will buy powder.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy powder.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está casada,  vive con sus hijos y esposo, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marta is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her children and husband who are her highest priority. With her loan she intends to complete the purchase of high quality bean seeds with high germination rates, fertilizers and other products to apply to the planting. In addition, she will pay for manual labor to apply the products and for assistance with the plants once she has grown them, this way she will be assured that they will do a good job.

What she intends to do is to take advantage of the good climate conditions and soil that they have in the area for this crop. She also wants to put into practice her various years of experience managing basic grains. Moreover, by being able to purchase these better high quality products she can ensure her crop develops well, is healthy, and provides an appropriate harvest and a significant short-term production as well.

She wants to spend her earnings from the harvest that she hopes to obtain on the wellbeing and the schooling of her family and to accomplish certain family goals, and to continue investing in more crops. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not been able to obtain other loans previously from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina. He moved to the United States in 2007, just before the financial crisis.

Diego struggled to find work during this tough economic time. His friend offered him a job as a helper on a truck and, with his friend’s guidance, Diego obtained his Commercial Drivers License in 2012.

Diego immediately started driving commercial trucks. He had a few contracts in place with large companies to transport dry goods.

In January, 2015, he received the opportunity to become an owner operator, which enabled him to double his income. He bought his first truck this year and is on his way to building a successful trucking business.

Diego originally came to the United States to provide a better life for his wife and young children. As Diego has built up his business in the United States, his family has waited in Argentina for him to save up enough money to bring them here. Since starting his business this year, Diego has come much closer to achieving this goal.

As he prepared for the busiest time of the year, he applied for a loan at a bank and was declined. A Kiva loan will help Diego pay for some essential repairs on his truck as he heads into the holiday season.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his truck as he gets into the busiest season of the year.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 44 years old, married, and has seven children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jona has an ice cream making business in the Philippines.

Jona requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream making business.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream making business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido a la pobreza ya no pudo seguir, es padre soltero, porque su pareja lo abandonó, tienen 3 hijos pero todos están casados.
 
Juan, desde que tiene 12 años trabaja en la agricultura junto a su papá, pero también le gusta trabajar criando ganado y los cultivos que más siembra son maíz y lo hace a un kilómetro de su casa.- Su día de trabajo comienza a las 5:00 a.m. porque tiene que levantarse a preparar su comida para luego irse a trabajar y solo labora 6 horas y regresa a casa para descansar y hacer el almuerzo.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos para engordarlos.


Juan, sueña con comprar 3 vacas lecheras y hacer una porqueriza para crecer, engordar y vender cerdos.
texts.en:
Juan is 61 years old. He studied until the 4th grade. Because of his impoverishment he was not able to continue school. He is a single father, because his partner left him. He has 3 children, but all of them are married.

Juan, beginning when he was 12 years old, worked in agriculture together with his father, but he also likes to work raising livestock. The crop that he plants most is corn and he does it a kilometer from his home. His work day begins at 5am because he has to get up to prepare his food so he can later leave to work. He works for 6 hours and returns to his home to rest and to make lunch.

Juan needs the loan to purchase pigs to fatten. Juan dreams of purchasing 3 milk cows and of having a pig farm to raise, fatten and sell pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Nuncia

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Nuncia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as a refrigerator, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, water, Fanta, Coca-Cola and beer.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Nuncia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family.

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, water, Fanta, Coca-Cola and beer.

loans.name: Natercia

texts.en:
Natercia is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy animals like buffalo, cows, pigs and chickens. After she buys them, she will bring them to the market.

Natercia started her business in 2007 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to increase her business in future.

loans.use: to buy more buffalo, cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
For the past five years, Teresita, has engaged in a hog-raising livelihood. She raises and sells pigs to the local settlers in her place. She is a 37-year-old single woman with no dependents.

Aside from hog raising, she also engages in a direct-selling business. She sells Avon products like lotion, face powder, ladies accessories and clothing.

Teresita has requested a loan to buy feed and Avon products like whitening soap, ladies accessories and apparel. This could help enhance her income and slowly enable her to settle her obligations. This will provide an adequate supply of feed and continue improve her livelihood.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to have a stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and Avon products like whitening soap, ladies accessories and apparel.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 37 years old and single.

Emelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

Emelyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Emelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 60 years old and married. She has three children.

Eden earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Eden is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maria Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Maria Cecilia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Maria Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase ingredients and utensils for the restaurant business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils for the restaurant.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda, 43, is a married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Roda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Roda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, fruits and other materials for her food production business.

Roda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar and fruits for her food production business.

loans.name: Solonie

texts.en:
Solonie is 26 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Solonie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her pig-pens.

In the future, Solonie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair her pig pens.

loans.name: Lealtad

texts.en:
Lealtad is 62 years old, married and has six children.

Lealtad is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lealtad requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Lealtad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second-hand clothes and she also sells local products like a rice, corn and other things.

Regina has been involved in business activities for a year. She started with her own working capital of $100. She is still happy to do her business.

She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes, rice and other things.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and married. She has four children and works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Dalia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

In the future Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 55 years old and has eight children. Cristina is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Cristina has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cristina has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 45 years old and three of her children are presently in school.

Marissa has a buy-and-sell personal products business in the Philippines. Marissa has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional products such as perfume, body lotion, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as perfume, body lotion, beauty soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old, married and has two children.

Helen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Sumie

texts.en:
Sumie is 35 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is still in school.

Sumie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Sumie has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Sumie has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sumie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She has a doormat making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 16 years.

Gina requested her second loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fabric and materials needed to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 38 years old and married with one child. Teresa works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresa has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Cathérine est une femme mariée qui vit avec deux enfants à charge à Baguida. Cathérine est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Cathérine sollicite ce crédit pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Cathérine is married and lives in Baguida with two children that are in her care. She resells secondhand clothing as a traveling saleswoman in the neighborhoods that surrounds the market where she gets her supplies twice monthly.

In order to build up a large stock and meet all customer demand, and maximize her profits, Cathérine is seeking this loan to order bales of secondhand clothing.

She foresees turning a profit in order to help her husband cover the various daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Ortiqjon

texts.ru:
Ортикчон образованный мужчина из города Душанбе. Ему 34 года. Он отец троих детей. Ортикчон верный муж, заботливый отец и сын. Ортикчон работает в МДО "Хумо" консультантом. У него прекрасное чувство юмора или как называют "душа компании".
   Ортикчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы устроит оздоровительное мероприятие в семье. Его жене и маме нужно восстановить здоровье и отплатить детям услуги стоматолога. С такой большой целью он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Ortiqjon is an educated man from Dushanbe. He is 34 years old and the father of three children. Ortiqjon is a loyal husband and an attentive father and son. Ortiqjon works for MDO Humo as a consultant. He has an excellent sense of humor and is the life of the party. He has applied for a loan in order to provide medical treatment for his family. His wife and mother need to regain their health and he must pay for dental services for his children. He is applying for a loan for these big goals.

loans.use: to get medical treatment for his family

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old, widowed and has seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She operates has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Erlinda requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more gasoline to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Marlie

texts.en:
Marlie is a 46-year-old widow and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Marlie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marlie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Marlie has been farming rice for nine years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 52 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and repair her pig-pens.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair her pig-pens.

loans.name: Corinne

texts.en:
Corinne is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child still in school.

Corinne is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Corinne requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Corinne has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Corinne would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

Emily has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Emily would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Mary Hershe

texts.en:
Mary Hershe is 26 years old, with three children. With two children in school, Mary Hershe works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Hershe runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. She requested a 3,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Mary Hershe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as condiments, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jhaname

texts.en:
Jhaname is 21 years old, with one child, Jhaname works very hard to provide for them.

Jhaname runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

Jhaname has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Jhaname would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old and married with four children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned good, spices, noodles and other groceries.

Grace has been in this business for two years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned good, spices, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Kulmira

texts.ru: Кулмира, 54 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. Кулмира занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец. На 1,85 Га собственной земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Также у Кулмиры есть швейный цех, в котором работают два человека. Благодаря упорному труду, Кулмира на сегодняшний день имеет совокупную  прибыль до 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего швейного бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материалов для пошива одежды. Доходы от кредита Кулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulmira is 54 years old and married with four children. Kulmira works as a farmer and animal breeder. On the farm she has cows and ten sheep. On her 1.85 hectare plot she grows beans for profit. Kulmira also has a sewing shop with two employees. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a total income of approximately 12,000 KGS per month. In order to further grow her sewing business, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase material for sewing clothing. Kulmira plans to invest the income from this loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase material for sewing clothing

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 26 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Michel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Michel has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 33 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Regina has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Regina requested a 3,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rahmonjon

texts.ru: Рахмончон простой трудолюбивый дехканин района Бохтар. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Рахмончон живет вместе  с отцом, матерью, братом, женой и ребенком. Рахмончон имеет большой земельный участок во дворе, еще у него есть коровник. Он работает на земле и одновременно выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Дехканы любят зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. И они трудолюбивые люди. Рахмоначон готовится к новому посеву урожай. Он хочет, посадит огурцы. Рахмончон решил за счет кредита приобрести семена и минеральные удобрения. У него нет возможности приобрести необходимые средство. С такой целью Рахмончон обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Rahmonjon is a simple, hardworking farmer from the Bokhtar region.  He is 28 years old and married with a child. Rahmonjon lives with his parents, brother, wife and child. He has a large plot of land on the farm and also a cowshed. He works the land and also raises cattle. Farmers like to make an honest living and they are hardworking people. Rahmonjon is preparing for a new harvest. He wants to plant cucumbers. Rahmonjon decided to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer because he did not have enough funds. With this goal in mind, Rahmonjon applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase synthetic fertilizer and cucumber seeds.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and married with four children, three of whom are presently in school. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, and shampoo and other personal care products. Lilia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, and shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Timy

texts.en:
Timy is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Timy has a general store business in the Philippines. Timy requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Timy has been in this business for six years. In the future, Timy would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roseny

texts.en:
Roseny is 31 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Roseny works very hard to provide for them.

Roseny has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Roseny has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Roseny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yusro

texts.en:
Yusro is a midwife who lives with her husband and her two daughters in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Yusro’s husband works as a laborer. She began to realize that they needed to save money for their children’s education, and so she decided to join Ruma.

Now, Yusro is a Ruma agent who provides mobile services to her community by selling mobile phone minutes and making utility bill payment transactions right from her cell phone. Yusro feels glad because the business she runs has a social impact on her community.

She can now process around $700 in transactions per week. As her business continues, Yusro hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more of these mobile services to her community. In the near future, she plans to expand her business by becoming an agent for Ruma's new e-commerce service to lower-income communities, called Mapan, for her current customers. She is the one who is seen in the photo, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile phone credits for her community

loans.name: Naroeurn

texts.en:
Naroeurn, 51, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province and a married woman. She is blessed with three children, one of whom is in school. To make a living, she grows crops, while her husband provides motor-taxi service to add more income. Pests are the challenge to her farming.

Having been with VisionFund for a cycle, she has used her loan to improve living condition. This time, Naroeurn will use her loan to pay for tuition fees for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to study Information Technology until he graduates and he can get good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son who is studying IT.  She is a farmer and her husband drives a taxi

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ayip

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! This is Ayip, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married and he and his wife have been blessed with one cute child. As the head of the family, Ayip realizes he needs extra income to save for his children’s education.  

About one year ago, Ayip met a Ruma field staff person who convinced him to start a business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments to his surrounding community. He now has become a successful agent since his customers are people in the urban area who all need such services. 

As the business grows, Ayip hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions especially on the weekends. In the near future, Ayip plans to add more products from Ruma, such as e-commerce for low income communities called Mapan. Ayip is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Eddy, one of Ruma's agents. Eddy lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his three children.

Eddy is a one of the staff of a local bread factory. He and his wife realized that they needed more income to save for their children's education, and that's why he decided to join Ruma. Right now, he became a mobile airtime credits agent for his friends in the factory as well as his community. Eddy is a hardworking guy as well as a trusted mobile airtime provider.

As the business grows, Eddy needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones no matter how far apart they are.

Eddy’s goal in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Eddy is the one who is sitting. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза доброжелательная женщина из Сарбандского района. Ей 36 лет она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Фируза на протяжении 15 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Имеет хороший опыт и постоянную клиентуру.   В связи с увеличением потребностей клиентов Фируза решила расширить ассортимент своих товаров. Однако чтобы достичь этой цели она обратилась за помощью в получении кредита с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Firuza is a kind woman from the Sarband region. She is 36 years old, married, and has a child. Firuza has been selling food goods for 15 years. She has good experience and regular clients. As a result of the increase in demand from her clients, Firuza has decided to expand her range of goods. However, in order to achieve this goal she has applied for help in receiving a loan from you.

loans.use: to expand her range of goods.

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Vergilio is 67 years old, married with two children, and he resides in Barangay Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Vergilio has been growing and harvesting rice to sell in town, and he has had this business for many years. This is the primary source of income for his family. With his generated income, he was able to successfully repay his previous loan, which was also used for farming.

Vergilio has recently taken a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. Vergilio is hoping his farm will flourish, enabling him to improve the family's standard of living and save for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 53-year-old woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lydia has a retail candle business in the Philippines. She has requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more candles to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell.

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
Rhea Mae is 21 years old and married, with one child who is in school. Rhea Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Rhea Mae has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soap, spices, and personal care products.

In the future, Rhea Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old, with five children. With one child in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items. She has requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 33 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Maricel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and married with four children. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
In his early 40s, Khom is a married father of two dependent children who are in still in school. He resides in Kampong Thom province where he and his wife have been running businesses of selling grocery items and growing rice for years. 
Khom is now requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fee for his son. He hopes that his son will have a bright future and get good paid job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee for his son.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is a 67-year-old widow living with her 4 children in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Since her husband past away she has taken charge of their coconut farm activities. Rizalina took a previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy fertilizer and was successfully repaid. Recently, she requests a new loan to finance the labor costs for harvesting and picking coconut fruit. Rizalina plans to cultivate the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future and provide her family a better living condition.

loans.use: To pay labor costs.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Roda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Roda requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Roda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Roda would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with four children. Shirley is 40 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Shirley has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Shirley has been in this business for one year. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 66 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, personal products, school supplies and groceries.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with six children. Anita is 41 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anita has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Anita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Shella Mae

texts.en:
Shella Mae is 27 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Shella Mae is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Shella Mae has been farming sugarcane for seven years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn is 48-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom rely on her. There is a child who is in school and needs her support. From Kampong Cham province, she and her husband have been growing rice and working for other for a fee to make a living.

Oeurn is now requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fee for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to go to school with enough school materials.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee for her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Seanghort

texts.en:
Seanghort is 34 years old and she is a married mother of a dependent child. From Kampong Thom province, she makes a living through growing rice and cassava. She has been involved in her business for five years. Price drops for cassava are the main challenge to her farming business. 
She is now applying for a loan from VisionFund to pay tuition fee for her younger sister. She hopes that this loan will enable her sister to study Accounting so that she can get good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her younger sister.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Laura Felipa

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Laura Felipa, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia Laura Felipa, continua con su negocio de venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, la socia espera mediante su negocio poder obtener mas ganancias y de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de menestras, carnes, arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
This is Señora Laura Felipa, who is a member of the bank “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of the Tremors II) of the city of Cusco, Perú.

Laura Felipa continues with her business selling food as a street vendor. She is grateful for the credit granted and agrees to comply with the loan payment due dates. She puts a lot of time into her business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts it every day. Laura Felipa is an enterprising woman, she hopes that through her business she can obtain a better income and thus continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of "menestras" (bean and vegetable soups), meat, and rice, among other things.

loans.use: to buy things for bean and vegetable soups, meat, and rice, among others.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolorosa is 44 years old and has eight children who are currently in school.

Dolorosa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dolorosa requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Dolorosa has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 42 years old and has three children. Amelia is a woman and has one child in school.

Amelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amelia has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Belle

texts.en:
Belle is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Belle is 58 years old and has two children are still in school.

Belle has a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines. Belle requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials for her business.

Belle has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials for her business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a poultry business in the Philippines. Shirley is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order tom improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en un taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene un hijo que está estudiando y vive con ella, también su suegra vive en la misma casa.

Lucia, tiene un venta de comida típica como enchiladas, yuca, frita, pastelitos de carne desde hace un año y este negocio lo aprendió gracias a su mamá; pero aparte de eso también trabaja haciendo tortillas para otra persona y su horario es desde las 6:30 a.m. hasta las 2.30 p.m.

Lucia, necesita el préstamo para comprar yucas, plátanos, maíz y otros productos para mejorar su situación económica para comenzar el negocio.

Lucia, sueña con que su negocio sea exitoso e invertir más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Lucía, 32, studied up to the fourth grade. She is married, and her husband works in a metal workshop. She has a son who goes to school and lives with her. Her mother-in-law lives with them too.

Lucía has been selling traditional food, such as enchiladas, fried cassava, and meat pies for a year. She learned this activity thanks to her mother. She also works making tortillas for someone else. She works from 6:30 am until 2:30 pm.

Lucía needs the loan to buy cassava, plantains, corn, and other products to improve her financial situation and start her business.

Lucía dreams of having a successful business and being able to invest more in it.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plantains, corn, and other products.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 58 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felipa has a chainsaw rental business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 30 years. 

Felipa requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase gasoline, chainsaw, and other supplies for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, chainsaw, and other supplies.

loans.name: Imron

texts.en:
This is Imron, one of Ruma's agents. Imron lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia, together with his wife. Imron owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provide bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business using technology. He is a friendly and informative mobile provider, that’s why he has many customers.

As the business grows, Imron needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Imron’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called 'Mapan'.

As seen in the photo, Imron is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Ritheya

texts.en:
Ritheya is 18 years old, single, lives with her family at Khsach Kandal district , Kandal province.
Currently, Ritheya is a student,while her father is a teacher at a public school. Moreover, her brother works for Maxima Microfinace Plc.

She has studied at Norton University in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in the field of Finance and Banking , for 1 year, semester 1. She said that “ she will get much salary in the future . She would likes to apply for a loan for pay her school fees to achieve this.

loans.use: to pays for her university fees for a BSc.in Banking and Finance.

loans.name: Kakada

texts.en:
Kakada is 22 years old, single, and lives with his family in Chba Ampov district, Kandal Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Nowadays, Kakada is a student and he has worked for a private company for three years. He is studying at NTTI in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in the field of Electricity, year four, semester one.

Kakada would like to apply for a loan for pay his school fees and purchase study materials. Kakada wants to be a good staff electrician.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees and purchase study materials.

loans.name: Idimo

texts.ru: Жительница Яванского района Идимо на протяжении 12 лет занимается животноводством.  Ей 47 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Старший сын в данный момент находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Второй сын помогает отцу в его работе.  Как правильно ухаживать за животными Идимо научилась у своего отца. Теперь она хочет купить телят и, откормив их продавать на местном рынке.  А за счет полученной прибыли Идимо намерена выдать замуж свое дочь. Она просит помощи у Вас для выполнения этой миссии.
texts.en: Idimo lives in the Yavan region and has been a cattle farmer for 12 years. She is 47 years old and married with four children. Her eldest son is currently working abroad in Russia. Her second eldest son helps his father with his work. Idimo learned how to properly care for cattle from her father. Now she wants to purchase calves to fatten up and sell at the local market. Idimo plans to use the resulting profit to marry off her daughter. She asks for your help to complete her mission.

loans.use: to purchase several calves

loans.name: Alexs

texts.es:
Alexs con 25 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 5 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en las diferentes labores de mantenimiento en su cultivo de café, en la compra de abonos, con ello podrá incrementar los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Alexs es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado créditos anteriormente los cuáles los canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Alexs, 25, is married. He lives with his partner and his underage son in the Callayuc district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department of Peru. Locals can give very good personal and professional references of him. Locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.

He grows coffee, and has a five-year experience in this activity. He is requesting a loan to invest in different maintenance activities and buy fertilizers. This will help him to improve his plantations' productivity.

Alexs returned as a member to Edpyme Alternativa. He has received loans previously, and has paid them according to plan.

loans.use: to invest in different maintenance activities for his coffee plantations, and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es: Cesar es un joven trabajador que a sus 24 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 2 meses de edad en vivienda propia. Él desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida para apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, por lo que no logro continuar sus estudios, y desde hace 5 años se dedica  a prestar sus servicios de mecánico automotriz. Cesar desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que actualmente toda su vivienda es de materiales frágiles, por lo que buscando brindar mayor seguridad para su familia, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto y de esta manera mejorar poco a poco su hogar.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young hardworking man who is 24 years old. He has his own home where he lives with his life partner and his young daughter who is 2 months old. Since he was young, Cesar has learned to make a living in order to help out with the household expenses. For this reason, he wasn't able to continue studying. For the past 5 years, he has made a living working as an auto mechanic.

Cesar would like to build a room in his home, since his house is currently constructed out of fragile materials, and he is looking to provide his family with a safer home. He is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build this room, and through this, he will being to gradually improve his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room, and through this, he will begin to gradually improve his home.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecelia is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Cecelia has a used shoes vending business in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

Cecelia has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Cecelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 50 years old and single, Genara works very hard to provide for them.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Genara has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Dalin's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province, Dalin is 42 years old and she is a mother of two children, one of whom is dependent on her. To support her living condition, she has been working as a nurse, raising piglets and chicken for 12 years. For few years, her business didn’t grow well as the pigs and chicken got sick.

Therefore, she leads a group of two to request a new loan, which is the tenth loan of her with VisionFund to save her business. With the previous loans, which enabled her to improve her family’s living, were completely repaid. For this time, she will use the loan portion to buy more piglets, chickens and pigs feed to support her business in order to earn more income for her family. She hopes to sell it in good price so that she can afford to expand her current business bigger and thereby let her to upgrade her lifestyle than before.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her pig-raising to earn more income

loans.name: Kimchhorn

texts.en:
Kimchhorn is a 36 years old woman from Kampong Thom province. She is blessed with three dependent children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband are selling fish and growing rice to make a living. 
She decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for her daughter. She hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to study in university so that she can have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Oscar Joel

texts.es:
Oscar, de 27 años de edad, es chofer, el aprendió este trabajo junto a su padre a quien acompañaba todos los días en sus jornadas laborales, porque él trabajaba como chofer de una panadería; ahora Oscar, ya tiene 4 años de experiencia como chofer de una moto taxi, en donde traslada personas de un municipio a otro.

Oscar, necesita el préstamo para comprar llantas y para pagar la reparación de suspensión de su moto taxi, porque por el arduo trabajo del día a día algunas piezas de su equipo han dado la vida útil y es necesario cambiarlas para dar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes.

Oscar, sueña con tener una casa propia y comprar un vehículo para prestar servicio de trasporte.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old, and he is a chauffeur. He learned this occupation from his father, who he used to accompany everyday to work while his father was working as a chauffeur for a bakery. Now Oscar has 4 years experience as a moto taxi chauffeur, in which he transports people from town to town.

Oscar needs a loan to buy tires and pay for the repair of the suspension of his moto taxi. Due to everyday wear and tear of his work, several parts of his vehicle are no longer useful and need to be changed in order to provide his customers with a higher level of comfort.

Oscar's dream is to have his own home and buy a vehicle to offer transport services with.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for the repair of the suspension of his moto taxi.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 31 years old, married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Leizel has as oyster famr business in the Philippines. Leizel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

Leizel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Leizel would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Kouy's Group

texts.en: Kouy’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kouy makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hokcheang's Group

texts.en: Hokcheang’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hokcheang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Em makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en: Kimsan’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kimsan makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en: Thol’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thol makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Adbeel Leumin

texts.es: Adbeel es una joven estudiante de diseños de modas.  Ella se siente muy contenta porque ya solo le quedan dos años para terminar su carrera profesional. Y poder hacer los que más le gusta   diseñar y confeccionar prendas de alta costura. Ella trabaja en horas de la tarde para poder ayudarse con los gastos de sus estudios. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina industrial recta y el pago de sus pensiones universitarias. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Abdeel is a young Fashion Design student. She feels happy knowing that in just two years she will finish her professional studies. She will start doing what she likes the most, which is to design and make high fashion garments. She works in the afternoons in order to be able to pay her tuition fees.

She will use this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine, and pay the tuition fees. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for the loan she received.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Llankasun De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLANKASUN DE LARES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lares, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina, la socia continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva años con su  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro no pertenece al banco comunal Llancasun de Lares.
texts.en:
The people in the photo belong to the communal bank Llancasun de Lares. This bank is located in the district of Lares, which belongs to the Calca province in the city of Cusco.

Sra. Josefina is one member and she runs her own restaurant business. She has had this business for years, and it has gone well for her thanks to the dedication and effort she puts towards her business everyday. She is a entrepreneurial woman who wishes to earn more income through her business so that she can continue to support her family. Sra. Josefina makes different types of meals for her customers, and this has been the way in which she has supported her family.

Sra. Josefina is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, vegetable stew, and more. The other members make a living selling animals, working in agriculture, running a grocery store, and running a food sales business. The members are thankful to those who, through this loan, form part of their dreams, and they promise to fulfill the loan payments on time.

The person whose face has a white circle over it does not belong to the communal bank Llancasun de Lares.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, vegetable stew, and more.

loans.name: Sumaq Llankay Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SUMAQ LLANKAY.
La socia Bacilia tiene 36 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con du negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is one of the members of the Sumaq Llankay communal bank.

Bacilia is 36 years old, single, and has a son. Besides her daily activities, she sells food. She has had this business for some time now and is doing well thanks to how hard she works every day. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to increase her profits through her business, in order to continue supporting her family. She prepares different dishes that her customers order. This is how she gets ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, vegetable oil, meat, and other ingredients.

All the members are grateful for the loan they received, and promise to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 62 years old and a widow. She lives in Pagadian City. For the past 20 years, Lilia has been a farmer. She earns 5,500 PHP each month and is an active member of PMPC. Lilia is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is married and lives in Pagadian City. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop. She's requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community. Evangeline hopes to continue her business, and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, Gloria availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale.

Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.en:
Crisostomo is 64 years old and lives in Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with three children. Crisostomo has a fish-selling business and owns a fishing boat business; he earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for his fish-selling business. Crisostomo has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for his fish-selling business.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Noniluna

texts.en:
Noniluna is 49 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Noniluna works very hard to provide for her family.

Noniluna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Noniluna has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Noniluna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Janet has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, and other fishing supplies.

Janet has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
58-year-old Felicidad engages in selling snack food to cover the daily household expenses of her family. She prepares and sells puto ( steam rice cake), bibingka ( a kind of rice cake that is being cooked in an oven made of clay) and suman budbud ( glutinous sticky rice).

She is married and has seven grown children. She is striving hard to improve her income. She lives in the town of Carmen, Bohol, where her husband is a farmer.

Felicidad would like to take a loan to purchase a variety of ingredients like flour, banana and sticky rice. In that way, she could able to display and prepare varieties of snack foods to sell, attracting more consumers to purchase. These will help increase her profitability and continue investing other sources of income to become productive.

She is thankful for Kiva and CEVI for support. With her previous loan, she was able to repay it successfully and now she is requesting a new loan to continue improving her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ingredients like flour, banana and sticky rice.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is 60 years old and lives in Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. Esterlina has a fish-selling business and owns a fishing boat business; she earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish-selling business. Esterlina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for her fish-selling business.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from Pagadian City. She and her husband have a rice paddy and earn a living doing farming activities. Recently, Erlinda requested a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland; she hopes to produce a larger harvest. Erlinda deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a carabao to plow and harrow their wetland.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna wants to increase her harvest. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

Emma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

loans.name: Plon's Group

texts.en:
Plon is 38 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Rice and cassava growing are the primary sources of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 20 years. Besides this, she also raises pigs to earn additional income. With the current business, she can earn approximately 33,000 KHR per day and save about 16,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

This is the first micro loan for Plon’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Plon will use her portion to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sumber Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Wawan, 45 years old, is a leader of Sumber Rejeki Group. They are standing in front of a cow house. Karni, Wawan's friend had also photographed together with the group members, and he has agreed to be displayed on Kiva. Wawan has a family with two children and live in a tiny village in Lampung Tengah, Indonesia.

Wawan strives to improve his family's economic condition. He has been running a small-scale rice farming business and has a few cows to fatten and resell. His business is going quite well. However, he was deeply concerned to see the high price of non renewable cooking gas and also seeing the cow dung is wasted in the nearby field, which pollutes the air with a pungent odor.

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and Lembaga Pengembangan Pertanian Nahdatul Ulama/LPPNU (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) programme, Wawan saw that biogas is a good solution of his problem. He saw opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants. In order to make it happen, Wawan invited four of his farmer friends to form a borrower group. He is keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other group members to make it possible.

Wawan have an optimism that if he can build a bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also want to sell the remaining bio-slurry to increase his family income. He hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas.

loans.use: to build a bio-digester facility and utilization of bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma es una mujer trabajadora de 36 años de edad. Es soltera, sin hijos y actualmente vive en el Distrito Federal, en donde tiene su negocio. Luego de muchos años de ejercer su carrera técnica como asistente ejecutivo y administración de empresas, Alma tomó la decisión de emprender un nuevo camino independizándose económicamente.
Hace cinco años, Alma tomó la decisión de abrir una tienda general en la que vende artículos tecnológicos y da servicio a clientes en esta materia, perfumería, papelería y abarrotes.
Con el fin de hacer crecer su tienda y convertirla en una cadena de sucursales, Alma ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar más mercancía y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Motivada por esa idea y por la lucha para conseguir sus objetivos, Alma dedica su tiempo para sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking woman who is 36 years old. She is single without children, and currently lives in the Federal District, where she has her business.

After many years working as an executive assistant in the field of business administration, Alma decided to start down a new path towards financial independence.
