Five years ago, Alma decided to open a general store in which she sells technology products, and also sells additional products including perfume, stationery products, and groceries.

With the goal of growing her store and expanding it to create more branches, Alma is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise in order to increase her sales. Motivated by this idea and striving to achieve these goals, Alma dedicates her time to moving her business forward.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Soknea's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Prey Prosob district of Kratie province, Soknea is 34 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependent and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming cassava and working for others for a fee for 16 years. The current business earns her family about 48,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs, but she can save about 19,000KHR each day after daily expenses. The low price of cassava has been the main challenge for her business.

Soknea has never been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Vannoeun

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Takeo province’s Trang district, Vannoern is aged 60 years and married with seven children. To make a living and support her big family, Vannoern and her husband have been farming rice and raising buffaloes as primary business for 35 years.

This is her third microloan from Kiva partner, VisionFund. The past loans have enabled her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is asking for a new loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees, to study accounting at local university. She hopes that this loan will help her daughter to stay in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old, and married with adult age children, from Pagadian City. She is a corn farmer, which is her primary source of income. She has been in this type of business for a long time, even before she got married.

Helen has expanded her corn farming and has produced bulk corn grains. She is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC through the loan program intended for farmers like her. The amount that she is loaned will be used to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pablia

texts.en:
Pablia is 63 years old. She is married and has three adult children. She lives in Pagadian City. Pablia has engaged in a livestock business, selling pigs and chickens. Her husband is also a farmer. They are striving for their future, as they grow old.

She applied for a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Pablia wants to save more for her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Melinda has been able to turn the tide in her favor, and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 32 years old, married and lives in Guisokan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, he is given priority in financial services, to alleviate his present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which he actively participated.

Arnel has seen the changes in his general living conditions from the moment he signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, he is asking for a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine, and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma con 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 15 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la instalación de su cultivo, para la compra de semilla,fertilizantes, lo cuál le permitirá realizar su siembra sin complicaciones.

Irma es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado ocho créditos los cuáles los canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Irma is 41 yeas old, and she is married. She lives with her husband in the district of Colasay in the Jaén province, in the city of Cajamarca in Perú. She has good personal and professional recommendations from residents in the area. The people in this area generally make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Irma makes a living in agriculture, more specifically she grows corn. She has 15 years of experience in this field of work. Irma is requesting a loan to invest in her farming facilities and buy seeds and fertilizers, which will enable her to carry out her harvest without problems.

Irma is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had eight previous loans, all of which she punctually repaid.

loans.use: to invest in her farming facilities and buy seeds and fertilizers, which will enable her to carry out her harvest without problems.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married with two children. She is 43 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where she has been growing corn to earn a living for 15 years. A member of PMPC for four years, Jocelyn is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ruvelen

texts.en:
Ruvelen works hard to support her family. Ruvelen is single with one child and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ruvelen requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Ruvelen has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Ruvelen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ade, one of Ruma's agents. Ade lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is young woman who wants to give impact to her community, as well as trying to become an independent entrepreneur. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. She already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system from her friend, who already joined Ruma before her. Right now, she is becoming an agent who sells mobile airtime credits to her friends and communities.

As the business grows, Ade needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Ade’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for lower communities, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. Ade is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 57 years old. Juanita works very hard to provide for her needs.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Juanita has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 39 years old and married with two children, two children are still in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs, snack foods and other personal care products.

Rosana has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 58 years old, and married with six children.

Lenie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

Lenie has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lenie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Salve has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Crescenciana

texts.en:
Crescenciana has worked in the field for more than 10 years now. She grows and sells rice to cover her family's needs and expenses.

She is 60-year-old married woman and has three grown children. He husband has a pension that can help defray household necessities. Together with her husband, she lives in the town of Batuan, Bohol.

Due to the high cost of farm maintenance and a lack of capital to continue operating her farming livelihood, Crescenciana would like to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers to improve the yield on her farm and to gain financial income. In that way, she could able to set aside half of the profit for emergency use and the other half for business expansion.

In that way, she could able to settle her obligations and continue to expand her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is heading for the next crop season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Rosela hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities -- growing, caring for and harvesting crops -- as well as earning income. Carolina has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Carolina has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Carolina hopes to purchase another rice paddy to cultivate, which will potentially increase income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 62 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. To make a living, her husband works as a farmer on their own farm while Angelina owns and operates a retail store. She has been in this line of work for years and earns PHP 5,000 a month.

Angelina joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative and is now applying for a loan of PHP 6,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, candies and many more. She hopes to earn additional profits from her the business so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her retail store.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 49 years old and married with ten children. Six of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elsie has a general store business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like soap, shampoo, canned good and other items.

Elsie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, shampoo, canned good and other items.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rita is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Rita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

Rita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rafaela is 57 years old and one of her children is in school.

Rafaela has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rafaela has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Rafaela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Andressa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Andressa works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Andressa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of jewelry to sell for her business.

Andressa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Dédé Agnès

texts.fr: Agée de 60 ans, Dédé est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec deux enfants à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Dédé vend des produits d’alimentations générales et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Dédé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de farine de manioc, de sucre et des cartons de détergents, Dédé sollicite ce crédit pour financer son achat et pouvoir bien revendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir au mieux les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Dédé is 60. She is married, and lives in  Baguida with two dependent children. To enable them to be well and happy,  Dédé sells general food products and earns a living thanks to this commerce. Dédé buys her stock twice every month at the market. To order bowls of manioc flour, sugar, and cartons of detergent, Dédé requests this loan to pay for her purchase so that she can make good sales and a satisfactory profit margin to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 40 bowls of manioc flour, 16 bowls of sugar, and 04 cartons of detergent.

loans.name: Jose Adelio

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de ventanas e intalacion de puertas y cielo falso se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años y gracias a ese trabajo es como ha podido solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como vidrios, espejos, puertas, divisores de ventanas, etc. para poder continuar con sus trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose is 38 years old. He lives in his own house with his life partner and son. He makes a living by making and selling windows and he also installs doors and false ceilings. He has been doing this for 20 years and this work allows him to cover some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy the materials he requires such as glass, mirrors, doors, window frames, etc. These materials will allow him to continue his work in order to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy the materials he requires such as glass, mirrors, doors, window frames, etc.

loans.name: Analuna

texts.en:
Analuna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analuna is 39 years old and all four of her children attend school.

Analuna has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Analuna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

Analuna has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Voahirana

texts.fr:
Voahirana vous remercie beaucoup de tout son cœur pour le crédit. Avec le prêt, elle a pu augmenter et diversifier les articles à vendre (pantalons, shorts, pullover). En outre, elle a pu ouvrir un deuxième point de vente. Elle est devenue très motivée à développer et à étendre encore son activité, en plus, son mari l'encourage et l'appui. 
Elle voudrait, de ce fait créer d'autre activité source de revenu afin de bien assurer la retraite du couple. Le couple envisage d'exploiter une activité agricole: élevage (activité qui n'exige pas beaucoup de leur temps)
texts.en: Voahirana expresses her very sincere thanks for the loan. With it, she has been able to increase and diversify her stock (trousers, shorts, pullovers). Also, she has managed to open another shop. She is now very motivated to develop and expand her business even more. In addition, her husband encourages and helps her. In view of this success, she would like to create another income generating activity, to provide sufficient means to provide for her and her husband's retirement. They are planning to run a farming business: livestock farming (an activity that does not take up too much of their time).

loans.use: to buy trousers, and shorts .

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, de 60 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y su hija más pequeña que está estudiando ultimo año de bachillerato, sus otros hijos son mayores de edad y viven con sus esposas e hijos; su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también es ayudante de albañil en la época de verano. 

Teresa, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace más de 20 años, es muy conocida en su colonia pues todos los vecinos le compran tortillas a ella; gracias a su trabajo pudo darles educación a sus hijos y ahora espera que su hija menor tenga la oportunidad de ir a la universidad. 

Teresa, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha nueva para hacer tortillas, porque la que tiene ya no le está funcionando bien.

Los sueñpos de Teresa, son poder salir adelante con su negocio y en un futuro colocar un comedor para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia y darles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, 60, is married and lives with her husband and her youngest daughter, who is in the last year of high school. Her other children are adults and live with their partners and children. Her husband works in agriculture, and also as a construction assistant during the summertime.

Teresa has been selling tortillas at home for more than twenty years. She is well-known locally; all her neighbors buy her tortillas. Thanks to her hard work, she could pay her children's education, and hopes now that her youngest daughter can go to the university.

Teresa needs the loan to buy a new griddle to make tortillas, since the one she has is not working well.

Her dreams are to get ahead with her business, and in the future be able to open a restaurant, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new griddle to make tortillas.

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive  Sandra es muy sencilla, y en ella vive con sus dos hijos una niña de 3 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que cada día se dedica a la venta de platos típicos como: pasteles de carne, yuca frita y sancochada, empanadas, entre otros productos muy solicitados por sus clientes. Sandra desea instalar una puerta en el baño de su vivienda, además de instalar balcones a las ventanas de su vivienda, para brindar mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una puerta y balcones para las ventanas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The home Sandra lives in with her two children is a very simple one. The children are a three-year-old girl and a seven-year-old boy.

She is an admirable woman who, each day, sells typical dishes such as: meat pies, fried and boiled manioc, and stuffed breads, among other products. They are in great demand by her customers.

Sandra wishes to install a door in the bathroom of her house [much needed, as you can see in the photo], and to install balconies [with iron bars] on her home, to assure greater security. For that reason, she is requesting a credit through FUSAI so she can purchase the door and the secure balconies for her windows.

loans.use: to invest in a door and, also, balconies with iron bars for the windows in her home.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María vive junto a sus 3 nietos una niña de 10 años y dos varones de 12 y 8 años de edad a los que ella cuida con mucho cariño y cada día busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella a sus 53 años de edad pone todo su esfuerzo para cada día brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus nietos, por lo que se dedica a la recolección y venta de productos reciclables, además vende prendas de vestir y los días que le llaman presta sus servicios domésticos, ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena para que sus nietos vivan mejor. María ha salido favorecida con un proyecto de construcción de vivienda, pero para ello debe construir un muro de contención que proteja la vivienda que le construirán, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir el muro que proteja su futura vivienda.
texts.en: Maria lives with her 3 grandchildren, a 10-year-old girl and two boys ages 12 and 8. She takes care of them with a lot of affection and every day tries to improve their quality of life. At 53 years of age, she makes an effort to provide better living conditions to her grandchildren. She works collecting and selling recyclable products, and also sells clothes and works as a housekeeper occasionally. She knows that her efforts are worth it and will help her grandchildren live better. Maria is receiving help from a house construction project, but needs to build a containment wall to protect the house being built for her. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall to protect her future home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall to protect her future home.

loans.name: Dovudjon

texts.en:
Dovudjon is a young and smart man. He lives with his five-member family in Tajikistan. He studied in school and always got excellent marks.

Dovudjon this year has enrolled at the university and is a student of the first course. Dovudjon is studying the world economy at the Tajikistan State University of Commerce.

Dovudjon is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to pay for university tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Juntos Por El Desarrollo Echarati Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO ECHARATI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Edith tiene 46 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de  venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo  con su  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “JUNTOS POR EL DESARROLLO ECHARATI” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, which belongs to the province of La Convención and Cusco department.

The member is Edith. She is 46 years old, has two children and is in a relationship. She combines her daily activities with her business of selling clothing. She has had the business for some time and things are going well for her, thanks to the determination she puts into her business each day. She is an enterprising woman who hopes that through her business to be able to obtain more profit to continue to support her family. This is the way she gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy coats amongst others.

The members as a group are grateful to those who form part of this dream and promise to comply with the payment of their installments on time.

loans.use: to buy coats amongst others.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is known for her delicious "bibingka" in Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is making such good sales this time that she wants to make use of the good fortune she's having. She wants to increase her production to respond to her increasing demand. She asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bibingka (rice cake) ingredients such as bags of rice, sugar, leavening, milk, butter and other items.

loans.use: to purchase bibingka (rice cake) ingredients such as bags of rice, sugar, leavening, milk, butter and other items.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 47 years old and married with four children.

Marieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marieta has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Marieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 32 years old and married with three children, all in school. Tessie works very hard to provide for her family

Tessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest area of Cambodia. She is 30 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her 8-year-old daughter and her husband. Her family owns 4 hectares of rice fields.

In 2003, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Kunthea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family's expenses and to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 67-year-old mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand in 2014 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management.

She operates a grocery shop and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more produce to increase her grocery stock. This will enable her to generate more income and improve her living standard by providing food and shelter for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy produce to increase her grocery stock

loans.name: Ñaupaqman Purisum Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ÑAUPAQMAN PURISUM”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa, la socia continua con su negocio  de restaurant, la socia lleva años con su  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong the the "Ñaupaqman Purisum" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, province of La Convencion, state of Cusco.

Rosa is one of the partners. She has had a restaurant for several years, which does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is an entrepreneurial woman that hopes to increase her business' profits to be able to continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil and pulses, among other items. 

The other partners work selling animals, cereal, food and at a convenience store. 

The partners thank the lenders and promise to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and pulses, among other items.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is 54 years old, married, and lives in Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She runs and operates a hog raising business through the financial assistance program of Paglaum MPC for farmers like her. Very recently she has asked for a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 51 years old. She is known in the Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers.

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, that all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is managing her snack vending business in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept bulk orders for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, butter & cheese for her snack vending business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, butter & cheese.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, with her two children.

To make a living, she has been running a cafeteria in their village for many years. Her income has helped a lot to support their living situation.

Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and new kitchenware to be used in her cafeteria business.

She is hoping to expand her little cafeteria and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and new kitchenware for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, 61 years old, is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family, after her husband passed away. She currently lives with her three, adult-age children in Pagadian City.

Teresa is a farmer, focusing on rice and vegetable farming. She wants to increase her crop yield on her rice farm. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase a water pump for her farming operation, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for her farm.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 66-year-old widow. To make a living, she owns and operates a farm. For many years, she earned well to support the family's lives. As a mother, she always wants to provide her family with a better living.

Recently, Carmelita took a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to pay the placement fees of her child for working abroad and she successfully repaid the loan.

Now, she avails herself of a new loan for the labor cost of harvesting. In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs of harvesting.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Farming has been Nenita's life. She has spent her lifetime in farming. She had mastered the craft in farming from land preparation, seed bed preparation, sowing, replanting, pre-harvest and post-harvest management and operation. She's been doing well with these activities and had generated enough income to send all her children to school until they finished college and landed good jobs.

Despite the fact that she does not need to till her land because she has received support from her children, she is still willing to do the same routines in farming because sitting and doing nothing for her makes her an unproductive citizen.

So, just recently, she asked for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Presh Vihea province, Sitha is a 33-year-old single woman who has been growing rice and cassava as the main source of her family’s income for 15 years. To better support her living conditions, she also raises chickens and cows. She can earn about 55,000KHR per day to meet family’s needs and manages to save about 40,000KHR each day for future needs. Low crop yield resulted from drought has been the main challenge for her business.

Sitha is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, Sitha wants to use her portion to build a decent latrine for use in her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for use in her family.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal vending. Tessie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell for her buy and sell firewood business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon, 40, is a widow who lives in Kampong Speu province. She is the mother of two children, one in school and the other too young for school.

Growing rice and working at a garment factory have been the main sources of her family’s income for three years. Her farm and the factory are not doing well so she earns very little income.

Sinuon is applying for a loan from VisionFund to pay for her daughter’s school fee. Her daughter is studying medical science at the university.

This is the first loan for Sinuon. She hopes her daughter will have a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s school fee to study medical science.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Wencesca

texts.en:
On June 27, 2015, Wencesca learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-up businesses. Wencesca tried her luck starting a business focused on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Wencesca borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Wencesca looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1990. Nigina is single and she lives with parents in South Tajikistan. Nigina’s family has 6 members. They live happily together.

Nigina has own business deal. She has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes in a local market for more than 5 years. Nigina sells different kinds of clothes and she renews the assortment of her goods every season. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothes for new season

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is always traveling to sell her various cosmetic products. This gives her an approximate income of PHP 9,000.00 per month. She needs to help her husband in providing for the needs of their growing family.

Rosalie is 25 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, her partner in all her financial needs for her business ventures. Recently, she has availed herself of a loan of PHP 15,000.00 as additional capital so that she can meet the demands of her growing number of patrons. The amount will be used to purchase additional stock for her buy & sell business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her buy & sell business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
She is Rosana, 59 years old, who is currently improving her tailoring business. She was able to faithfully repay the previous loan she got worth PHP 10,000. Thank you so much for your help, dear lenders! Through you, she was able to buy enough raw materials needed in her business like fabrics, threads, needles and other tailoring accessories. Her additional income helped sustain her family's daily expenses.

This time, she would like to ask for another loanof PHP 10,000. She will use it primarily for the medical check up of her daughter who just gave birth to a child. As a loving mother, she would like to ensure that the condition of her daughter and grandchild is OK.

Regarding her tailoring business, she will also buy the usual raw materials like cloths, threads, buttons, and other accessories. She's more inspired to work now because of the excitement and happiness brought by her grandchild. She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the medical check up of her daughter and new-born grandchild; to buy cloths, threads, buttons, and other accessories

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria makes a good earning on her farming activities in Pagadian City. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because her cost of living increased when her children entered college.

Demetria approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticide. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticide.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated her own land in Pagadian City and has yield good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that her vegetable field is ready for planting. Melchora knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Melchora hopes to buy neighboring land for more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 52 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Elizabeth has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 29 ans qui vit à Baguida. Célibataire et sans enfant, Akossiwa est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Akossiwa désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des sac de riz, des bidons d’huile et des unités de savons en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 29 years old and lives in Baguida. A single women with no children, Akossiwa sells food products, which she buys three times a month at the market and resells from under an awning in front of her house. Akossiwa is applying for this loan in order to finance the purchase a bag of rice, canisters of oil and soap. The additional earnings will help her contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice, two canisters of oil and 35 pieces of soap.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun, 52, is a widowed woman living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children who are under school age. Growing rice and raising fish have been the main sources of her family’s income for 7 years. Meanwhile, she has been selling grocery items to get additional income as well.

This year, her business has not been growing well and has enabled her to earn income only about 7USD per day. She is able to save around 4USD each day after offsetting her business expenses.

This is Yun’s fifth loan with VisionFund and she has enough consumption than before from the past loans. She is now leading a three-member group and she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fish feed to enhance her business. She hopes that the fifth loan will help her to earn more income so that she can expand her current business and thereby let her to improve her family’s living conditions to be better than last year.

loans.use: to purchase fish feed to enhance her fish-raising business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nolly

texts.en:
Nolly is 54 years old, married, and lives at Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,000PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 29 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian City. For the past two years, Mary Jane has been a farmer. She earns 4,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC.

Mary Jane is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is a corn grower in Pagadian City. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earning well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to buy corn fertilizers for better produce.  In the future, Emelita wishes to become the supplier of corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emesilda

texts.en: Emesilda landed at the right place for needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when her first business went bad. PMPC came as a rescue when she needed it the most.  Now she is taking another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Emesilda perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina con 58 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como son gallinas, patos, pavos y cuyes,con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita crédito para la compra de más aves de corral y de esta manera diversificar su negocio,con lo cuál tendrá mayores ventas y mayores ganancias.

Dina es socia recurrente para Epyme Alternativa, con un crédito anterior de S/.1000 cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Dina is 58 years old and legally separated. She lives in her own house in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, in Perú. She has very good references both personal and for work from the residents of her area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

She works raising and selling small animals like chickens, ducks, turkeys and guinea pigs with ten years experience in the business. Her business is located in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry and in this way diversify her business. She hopes to have greater sales and more profit.

Dina is a repeat member of Epyme Alternativa, with a previous loan of 1000 PEN repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from the village of Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 77 years old. Rita is married and has seven adult children.

To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops and hogs. Rita has been engaged in her business for many years and she feels weak because she cannot work on the farm and earn well from these activities.

Rita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed to feed her piglet and expand her business. Rita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglet.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, beans, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, beans, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to have a big retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a wholesale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, beans, soap and other items

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 59 years old, married, and has four children.

Emelinda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emelinda has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Enie

texts.en:
Enie is 50 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are presently in school.

Enie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Enie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Enie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old and married. She has two children who are in school. Diana works very hard to provide for them.

Diana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread and other snack foods.

Diana has been in this business for five years. In the future, Diana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread and other snack foods.

loans.name: Githaiti Gutera Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Beth. She is married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and she has undergone the training that has enabled her to run her farming more profitably.

Beth does dairy farming to earn her living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed that will increase cows' milk production. She hopes to get higher returns to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Beth is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feed that will increase cows' milk production.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman. She has 7 children.

Mwanasit operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Mwanasit will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable business.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has considerable preparation for the post harvest operations of her palay (pre-husked rice) in Pagadian City.  She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. Teresita hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest.

Mary operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour, rice, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread, and other items. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as very ambitious.

Joseph operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business.

Joseph will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to have a profitable business within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry never gets tired of attending to her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in Binuangan, Oroquieta City, for she owns the only store in their place. She's making good sales in her business that sufficiently support the needs of her family.

In need of additional capital to restock sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others, Cherry asks a loan from Paglaum MPC where she is an active member.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells auto parts. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of spare parts for autos. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts for autos.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is 62 years old and married. She has six children. Gerly works very hard to provide for them.

Gerly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread and other snack foods.

Gerly has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gerly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread and other snack foods.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy utensils for the café. Her business goal is to own a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her café.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells auto spare parts. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more auto spare parts. Her business goal is to be an importer of spare parts within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business shop.

loans.use: to buy more auto spare parts.

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es:
Coralia, de 49 años de edad, no estudio porque su familia no tenía los suficientes recursos económicos; es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que aún viven con ella, estudian y la ayudan en el hogar; pero aparte de ellos también su mamá vive con ella.

Coralia, tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural desde hace 10 años, este negocio lo inicio comprando cantidades pequeñas y ofreciendolas en su comunidad, su negocio está a 20 minutos de distancia desde su casa y viaja en autobús, su hija mayor se involucra en este negocio y comienza a vender desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta que termina la venta tipo 2:00 p.m.

Coralia, necesita el préstamo para comprar tres cajas de medicina, porque así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Coralia, sueña con vender mariscos para tener otro ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Coralia is 49 years old. She didn’t get an education because her family didn’t have the financial resources. She is a single mother with three children who still live with her, study, and help out in the house. Her mother also lives with her.

Coralia has had a business selling natural medicine for 10 years. She started out buying small quantities and offering them in her community. Her business is 20 minutes from her house and she takes the bus. Her oldest daughter helps out with the business and sells from 7:00 am until closing, typically 2:00 pm.

Coralia needs the loan to buy three boxes of medicine so that she’ll have more variety to offer her customers.

Coralia dreams of selling seafood and having another income for her family.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of medicine.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en: Demetria is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta City. She is 60 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra (dried coconut meat). She buys whole coconuts for this. Demetria has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance products and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Demetria hopes to succeed in this business in order to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is married and the father of two children. He describes himself as a good person and earns a living operating a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for ten years and works in a good area where most of his customers are locals. His biggest business challenge is a lack of adequate working capital, which is why he is requesting a Kes 50,000 loan to buy more electronics to sell. This is his fourth loan request with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous three loans and hopes that this one will make him financially stable and allow him to open a another store.

loans.use: to buy more electronics.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and other items. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is engaged in running a fruit and vegetable stall. She has been operating her business for 15 years and earns a monthly net income of 5,000 PHP.

She is 64 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

In 2015, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes.

Marcelina is requesting her second loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest.

He is a mason. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy masonry equipment and materials. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy masonry equipment and materials.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар мужчина среднего возраста в самом рассвете сил. Ему 43 года. Он с женой работают преподавателями. У них 1 общий ребенок. Ему 19 лет. Он учится в Университете. Акбар с женой мечтают, чтобы их сын получил диплом и стал образованным человеком, но на их пути стоит финансовая преграда. Их сын учится на платной основе. Если не оплатить учебный год, то сына могут отчислить и Акбар не может этого допустить и обращается за заемными средствами.
texts.en: Akbar is a middle-aged man in the prime of his life. He is 43 years old. He and his wife work as teachers. They have one child together. He is 19 years old. He is studying at university. Akbar and his wife dream of their son receiving a degree and becoming an educated person, but a financial barrier stands in their way. Their son is studying on a paid basis. If they do not pay for the academic year then their son may be expelled. Akbar cannot allow this to happen and is asking for loan funds.

loans.use: to pay for a year of university tuition for his son.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo el cual estudia y trabaja como ayudante de albañil en sus tiempos libres, ella vive en su casa junto a su hijo, su hermana y sus sobrinas. 

Santos, se dedica a la venta de pupusas por las tardes y noches, tiene más de 8 años dedicándose a este negocio y de esa manera ha logrado salir adelante con su hijo. 

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar otra plancha y una refrigeradora pequeña para helar gaseosas y otros productos. 

Santos, sueña con poder llegar a tener un negocio exitoso y grande para poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 55 years old, is a hard working woman. She is a single mother and lives with her son who studies and works as a contractor helper in his spare time. She lives in her house with her son, her sister and her nieces.

Santos makes a living selling pupusas in the afternoons and evenings. She has worked on this business for more than 8 years and, this way, she has been able to get ahead with her son.

Santos needs the loan to buy another griddle and a small refrigerator to chill sodas and other products.

Santos dreams of having a successful and large business in order to be able to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy another griddle and a small refrigerator to chill sodas and other products.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be visionary.

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, soda, washing soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, soda, washing soap, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, flour, soda, washing soap, and other items.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined.

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rains which affect business.

He will use the KES 63,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous and have well educated children. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Swafia

texts.en:
Swafia is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics and hair products. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics and hair products. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to boost business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has one child.

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, soda, washing soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 51,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, soda, washing soap, and other items. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, flour, soda, washing soap, and other items.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the harsh climate.

He will use the KES 55,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 46 years old and married. She never gets tired of tending her store.

Hazel's passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs. Hazel is a full fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. Hazel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her store like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread and other snack foods.

Jonalyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Erlinda has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 29 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее высшее образование, она на протяжении 10 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Дамиры, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 8 коров, 6 телят, 10 овец, 15 коз и 7 лошадей. Супруг Дамиры во всем помогает ей по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Damira is 29 years old, married, and has a son. She has a higher education. She has been rearing animals for ten years as the main income for her family. Thanks to Damira's hard work, at the present time she has eight cows, six calves, ten sheep, 15 goats and seven horses. Damira's husband helps her with everything on the farm. In order to develop her business further, Damira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and beauty products. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Munyiva

texts.en:
Munyiva is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife resides in Fairview, Quezon City with her husband, Ric, a janitor, and their five children. She operates a variety store that sells various products like canned goods, repacked condiments and spices, sachets of toiletries, bread, snack items, and many others.

Raising five children is quite a challenging task. This is the primary reason for Marife’s perseverance. Wanting to give her children the most prized inheritance, which is completed college education, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store (sari-sari) business and load retailing. She dreams for a more secured future and sufficient living conditions for them.

The profit from her business covers their family expenses, but paying for her children’s education would be problematic. She wants to gain more profit so she can better prepare for her children’s educational needs. To improve her business, she desires to ask for a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy more items to sell. In the long run, she hopes to convert her sari-sari into a grocery store.

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. Marife meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, composed of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be business minded. She operates a retail business where she sells secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru: Надежда, 51 год, вдова, есть сын. У Надежды среднее образование, с 1996 года, была выделена земельная доля и Надежда стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, также выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход от ведения бизнеса доходит до 14,000 сомов (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Надежда обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и корма для скота.
