Доходы от кредита позволят Надежде улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Nadezhda is 51 years old, a widow, and has a son. Nadezhda has a secondary education. She has been allocated a share of land since 1996, and Nadezhda began rearing animals and growing crops. Today she has two dairy cows, and she also grows barley for sale. Her monthly income from running the business is up to 14,000 som (KGS), but these funds are insufficient for a decent life and supporting a family. In order to develop her farm further, Nadezhda has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and feed for the livestock. The proceeds of the loan will enable Nadezhda to improve her family's well-being and save up to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy two cows and feed for her livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en: Jena has always loved farming and grown her own corn in Calamba. She has also always harvested good crops and earned a good living from this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to buy more land and prepare it for planting. Her goal is to earn additional money, and in the future she hopes to continue to buy more land on which she can plant corn.

loans.use: to buy land and prepare it for planting.

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en:
Dorothea is an 86-year-old widow with six adult age children from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since the year 2000 and accessed her initial capitalization for business prior to her retirement. She ventured into the retailing business supported by her loan from the cooperative. She also attended various trainings offered by the coop including financial literacy training.

Recently, she is asking for an amount to purchase maintenance medicines. She needs to make herself healthy up to the prime stage of her life so that she can maintain her membership in good standing.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán con 25 años de edad, vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y de sus menores hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación está en segundo año de producción, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 5 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) para su consumo y en ocasiones para la venta;además trabaja como peón agrícola. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Hernán es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Hernán, 25 years old, lives in the family house with his partner and minor children, aged 4 and 2 years old. He lives in Santo Tomás district, Cuervo province, located in Cajamarca, Perú. He has very good references, both personal and professional, from the district inhabitants. Most of the population in this town make a living in agriculture, trading and farming.

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. Nowadays, he owns 1 hectare of the Catimor variety, which is resistant to illnesses and plagues. His plantation is in its second year of production, and he has 5 years of experience in this area. Moreover, he raises livestock (hens, guinea pigs and pigs) and cultivates basic commodity products (yucca, bananas and vita) for his own consumption and for occasional sells. He also works as a farm worker.

The loan will be used to invest in the maintenance and farming of 1 hectare coffee plantation, securing a good production for the 2016 season, which will be reflected in a higher sales volume. Therefore, he will obtain a higher income to be able to improve his family and his own quality of life.

Hernán is a new member in Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his partner.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance and farming of 1 hectare coffee plantation.

loans.name: Macrine

texts.en:
Macrine is a married woman with three children. She operates a food stall where she sells fried chicken, and she has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Macrine describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more chicken. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more chicken.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old, and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Lilia is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lilia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 63 years old and widowed with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Celsa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adán es un hombre trabajador que a sus 41 años de edad se dedica a prestar sus servicios de mecánico automotriz en un taller que ha instalado en su vivienda, lo cual le ayuda a llevar el sustento a su hogar. Él  vive junto a su madre una señora de 82 años de edad a la que brinda todo su apoyo tanto en su alimentación como en su salud. En su taller Adán necesita de muchas herramientas, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica para comprar todas sus herramientas de trabajo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: tenazas, llaves, grúa para levantar carro entre otros muy necesarios para desempeñar bien su trabajo.
texts.en:
Adán is a 41-year-old working man who makes a living lending his skills as an automotive mechanic out of a garage that he has set up in his house.

The work helps him provide for his home. He lives with his 82-year-old mother and helps her with everything, from keeping her fed to keeping her healthy.

In his garage Adán needs many tools, but he doesn’t have the economic liquidity to purchase all of them. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy pliers, wrenches, and a car lift, among other items necessary to help him with his work.

loans.use: to buy pliers, wrenches, and a car lift, among other items necessary to help him with his work.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she knits seat covers. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of knitting materials. She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of knitting materials

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Erlene is 46 years old and married with three children. She is in the poultry business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

Erlene has been running her poultry business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер благодаря Вам успешно закончил учебу. Он теперь продвигает свою  работу.   У него свежие и хорошие продукты. Алишер хочет, чтобы жители покупали свежее и качественный продукты. У Алишер есть сестренка. Он старший сын в семье. Ее сестренка в этом году поступила в университет. Ей помогает Алишер. Алишер работает и помогает сестре на обучения. В Этом году у Алишер возникли маленькая проблема финансами, и не смог оплатит договор за обучения сестры. По этой причине Алишер просит кредит на оплаты договора за обучения сестры. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Thanks to you , Alisher successfully completed his studies. Now he is working. He has good fresh produce. Alisher wants residents to buy fresher and good quality produce. Alisher has a little sister. He is the eldest son in the family. This year his little sister has gone to university. Alisher is helping her. Alisher is working and helping his sister with her studies. This year Alisher has a little problem with finances and he has not been able to pay for his sister's tuition contract. For this reason Alisher is asking for a loan to pay for his sister's tuition contract. He believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to pay for his sister's tuition contract.

loans.name: Jefer

texts.en: Jefer runs and operates a souvenir store in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one infant child. He has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for three years. Recently, he availed himself of a loan from the cooperative to purchase more stock of stuffed toys and other souvenir items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of stuffed toys and other souvenir items to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Delia has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sandra Dinora

texts.es: Sandra cuenta con una pequeña venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lo cual le permite salir adelante con su familia, desde hace 10 años, gracias a sus años de experiencia cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos. Ella tiene 38 años de edad y vive con sus dos hijas de 14 y 3 años de edad a las que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor, por lo que las apoya para que estudien. Sandra desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda, ya que desea que sus hijas tengan un lugar propio para ellas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio para sus hijas, y brindar mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Sandra has a small business selling beauty products from a catalog.  This business has enabled her to get ahead with her family over the last 10 years.  Thanks to her years of experience, she has a lot of customers who seek her products.  Sandra is 38 years old, and lives with her two daughters aged 14 and 3.  She is always looking for ways to give them the best and to support their education.  

Sandra wants to add a bedroom to her house, because she wants her daughters to have their own room.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and steel to build a bedroom for her daughters to provide them with greater comfort.

loans.use: To buy building materials to add a bedroom to her house

loans.name: Lynnet

texts.en:
Lynnet is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bags.

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Lynnet's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more bags to sell.

Lynnet will use her anticipated profits to purchase additional merchandise. Her business goal is to own a bigger shop within five years. In the future, she hopes to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as being reliable.

Justus operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap, flour, rice, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be unpredictable weather.

Justus will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, rice, and other items. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a wholesale shop.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Justus will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 56 years old and married with seven children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Josie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Josie has been in this business for 16 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Vergelia

texts.en:
Vergelia is 71 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vergelia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Vergelia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is widowed. She is a careful mother of six children. Since her husband died, she is the only feed-keeper and up-bringer of her children.

Latifa is a very industrious woman, and she works hard to earn a living every day in a local market. She has been busy with buying and selling salads for more than ten years. Latifa has a point of sale in a local market. She has regular customers, thanks to her her tasty salads.

She is going to increase her working capital, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy salads. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy salads for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has 12 children. She describes herself to be hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains, pillow cases, and bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Domitila will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of curtains, bed sheets, and pillow cases. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to set up a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of curtains, bed sheets, and pillow cases.

loans.name: Mwigai

texts.en:
Mwigai is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals.

Mwigai says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 28 years old, married with two children, and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to earn a living. He is also a vehicle technician.

Recently, he requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase a new set of tires.

In the future, Leslie hopes for his children to finish their studies, and he hopes to double his income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a married man. He has six children. He operates a laundry business. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy washing detergents and a laundry machine.

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy washing detergents and a laundry machine.

loans.name: Rosebellah

texts.en:
Rosebellah, a married woman with one child, describes herself as ambitious. For five years she has been operating a farm where she grows maize and keeps dairy cows. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest challenge is unpredictable weather.

Rosebellah will use this Kes 50,000 loan, her first with SMEP Microfinance Bank, to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her enterprise, and she has a goal of owning a big dairy farm within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a married woman with seven children, operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her enterprise is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest challenge is inadequate working capital.

Florence will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 49 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Juanita is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juanita has been in this business for ten years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eugenia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Eugenia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables, fish, spices and related goods for her food vending business.

Eugenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish, spices and related goods for her food vending business.

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is 50 years old and married, with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elva has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle business.

Elva has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle business.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом отзывчивый, благородный и добрый человек. Он очень благодарен всем кредиторам за их помощь и поддержку. Благодаря ним его племянник продолжает учиться в Университете. Абдусалом очень рад, что смог помочь своим близким. Он мечтает, чтобы его племянник стал хорошим специалистом и помогал своим родителям. И на сей раз он тоже просит кредит, чтобы  помочь племяннику оплатить за его учебу. Его племянник очень надеется на него. Он не хочет потерять учёбу. Абдусалом полагается на Вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdusalom is a responsive, honorable and kind person. He is very grateful to all lenders for their help and support. Thanks to them, his nephew is able to continue his studies at the University. Abdusalom is very happy that he was capable to help his relatives. He dreams that his nephew becomes a good specialist and helps his parents. And now he is once again requesting a loan to help his nephew pay for tuition. His nephew relies on him because he does not want to abandon his studies. Abdusalom depends on Your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's university tuition

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es:
Olegario con 52 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la ganadería, a la cría y comercio de ganado caprino, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una pequeña finca de cacao, en la cuál toda su familia le ayuda en las labores agrícolas. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el negocio de compra de ganado para engorde y poder implementar más su negocio.De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de él.

Olegario es socio recurrente para nuestra Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Olegario is 52 years old, is in a legal union, and lives with his spouse and their four children in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has many good references, as many personal as work-related, from the people of the area. The inhabitants of this region primarily work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Olegario makes a living as a rancher, raising and trading goats. He has more than 15 years of experience in the field. Additionally, he works in agriculture and has a small cacao farm, which all of his family helps out with. The purpose of the loan will be to invest in his ranch, to buy livestock to raise, and to further support his business. In this way he’ll be able to increase his profits an acceptable amount and improve his quality of life.

Olegario is a recurrent member of our Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in his ranch, to buy livestock to raise, and to further support his business.

loans.name: Silent

texts.en: Silent is a Kiva borrower. He has seven children. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread,salt, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour,soda and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soda and other items

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 54 years old and a widow with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Dina has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling prepaid mobile phone cards and fattening pigs.

Dina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Leeh

texts.en:
Maria Leeh is 24 years old and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Maria Leeh requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria Leeh has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Leeh would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leda

texts.en:
Leda, a 51-year-old married woman, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for three years now. The recipient of three previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new one for PHP 12000 loan
to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Leda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Светлая душа, очаровательная улыбка и добрый взгляд - этими качествами Бог одарил Иноят. Ей 52 года. Она разведена с мужем. После развода Иноят стала сильной женщиной и невероятно целеустремленной. Она не боится трудиться. Вот сейчас Иноят решила начать новую деятельность в сфере животноводства. Она уверена, что справится с этой работой. На заемные деньги она купит несколько голов телят, начнет деятельность и постепенно соберет свою стаду.
texts.en: Pure soul, beautiful smile and kind eyes are the qualities that God has given to Inoyat. She is 52 years old and divorced from her husband. Following her divorce, Inoyat became strong and incredibly driven. She is not afraid of hard work. And now Inoyat decided to start a new animal husbandry business. She is convinced that she can handle this type of work. She will use this loan to buy several calves, start the business and gradually build her herd.

loans.use: to buy calves and start her animal husbandry business

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.ru: Это Бибирачаб. Ей 45 лет. Фотима жительница района Файзабад. У нее нет мужа, и детей растет одна. Бибирачаб работает учительницей в школе, и все свободное время посвящает детям. У нее маленькая заработная плата и позволить себе много она не может. Но Бибирачабу нужно отремонтировать свой дом, чтобы подготовится к зиме, и сохранить тепло в доме в холодный период года. На стройматериалы уходить не мало денег. Бибирачабу ничего не остается кроме того что обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: This is Bibirajab, who is 45 years old. She is a resident of the Fayzabad district. She does not have a husband and raising her children alone. Bibirajab works as a school teacher and devotes all of her free time to children. She has a very low salary and cannot afford much outside of the necessities. However, Bibirajab needs to repair her house in order to prepare for the winter and retain heat in the house during the cold season. Because construction materials cost a lot of money, Bibirajab had to request this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian con 57 años de edad,de estado civil soltero,vive en casa propia,junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la actividad de la fabricación de muebles,puertas,sillas,camas,etc,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 7 años, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de madera para la fabricación de muebles. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio,obteniendo más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Julian es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 6 préstamos, el último fué de S/.5,000.00 el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Julian is 57, single and lives in his own home with his son in the district of Cayalti which is in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru . He has very good references, as many personal as work, from the people in the area. The people in this town generally earn a living from agriculture and the livestock trade.

He earns a living from the manufacture of furniture, doors, chairs, beds, etc. and has more than 7 years experience in the trade. His business is based in his own home and he is applying for a loan in order to buy wood for furniture manufacturing. With this he can grow his business, earn more and improve his quality of life.

Julian is a regular member of Edpyme Alternativa and has had six loans, the last one of S / 5,000.00, which he repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture manufacturing.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a widowed woman. She has two children. She describes herself as being intelligent.

Priscillah operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. She hopes that, in the future, she wil have a good family.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Leoni

texts.en:
Leoni is 47 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leoni is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leoni has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 55 years old, married and the mother of eight children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies. Lilibeth has been in this business for ten years and taken out and repaid five prior loans to sustain her work. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig.

loans.name: Kimhach's Group

texts.en:
Kimhach is a 35-year-old married mother of four children. Three of her children are in school and the fourth is younger. She is a farmer living in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province.

As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy a boat motor to improve her fishing. She currently struggles to make a living by growing tobacco and works for others for a fee in order to supplement her income. Her tobacco crop yield was low because it was destroyed by insects, so she only earns about $7 per day. After expenses, she is able to save around $2 per day.

This is her second loan, and she used her past loan to purchase household supplies. She hopes to upgrade her standard of living next year.

loans.use: to buy a boat motor in order to improve her fishing business and earn more income for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 23 years old and lives in a wooden house with her two parents and her young brother. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of land on which they grow cassava. She just returned to live with her parents because she and her husband divorced after three years of marriage.

In 2015 she was trained how to weave silk scarves by Kiva's field partner Soieries du Mékong. This organization is a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Sophy’s scarves are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses. Thanks to a 450 USD loan, she will buy silk and pay for it to be dyed and prepared for the loom.

Please support Sophy so she can keep weaving beautiful, traditional, hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for it to be dyed and prepared for the loom so she can weave her scarves.

loans.name: Luneta

texts.en:
Luneta has a wide experience in farming. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earning money for her family, as well.

As a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she is seeking financial help to purchase rice seeds, so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

In the future, Luneta wishes to become the supplier of rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: In the year 2007, Francisco learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, he requested a loan to jump-start his corn production. After several months, he was able to repay the loan and to this day feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used in his business. He is requesting a new loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer for the next growing season. Francisco's goal for the future is to sustain his business and supply corn to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, including fertilizer.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, rice, flour, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals.

Catherine describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, soda, washing soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, soda, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a fertile area, and his primary customers are locals.

Daniel says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better and improved business.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has four children. When asked to describe herself in a word, she said, “Honest.”

For the past seven years Esther has had a shop where she sells such items as soap, sugar, bread, cereals, juices and flour. Her business is located in a good area, and she sells primarily to local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices.

This will be Esther third’s loan with Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She has applied for a 80,000 KES loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, bread, flour, cereals and salt. She will put her anticipated profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sugar, bread, flour, cereals and salt.

loans.name: Sylviah

texts.en: Sylviah is widowed and the mother of one child. She describes herself as focused and operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been in this business for five years and works in a good area where most of her customers are locals. Sylviah describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital and is requesting this Kes 80,000 loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. Her goal for the future is to own a wholesale shop within the next five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to give her child a good education. She has taken out and repaid four prior loans from SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 22 años de edad, está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres.

Susana, trabajo de secretaria desde hace 4 años, pero también se dedica a la venta de productos básicos y a través de este negocio pudo pagar sus estudios y el estudio de sus hermanos.

Susana, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, café, detergentes, entre otros productos para su negocio; pero también para comprar una computadora para que sus hermanos hagan las tareas; de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos económicos y ayudará a sus hermanos. 

Los sueños de Susana, son tener mejores instalaciones para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y adquirir uno nuevo préstamo para el mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
Susana, 22, is single, has no children and lives with her parents.

Susana worked as a secretary for four years but she has also worked selling groceries, and through this business she was able to pay for her studies, and the studies of her siblings.

Susana needs the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, bread, coffee, and detergents, among other products, for her business. However she also needs the loan to buy a computer so her siblings can do their homework. This way, she will improve her income and she will help her siblings.

Susana's dreams are to have better facilities in order to provide better service to her customers and to get a new loan for home improvements.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, bread, coffee, detergent and other products for her business, as well as a computer for her siblings to do homework.

loans.name: Kaario

texts.en:
Kaario is married and has six children. When asked to describe herself in a word, she said, “Humble.”

For the past five years Kaario has sold potatoes and cereals to earn an income. Her business is located in a good area and she sells primarily to those in her community. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

This will be Kaario’s fourth loan with Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She has applied for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more cereals and potatoes to sell. Her business goal is to have a big store within five years.

Kaario will use her anticipated profits to educate her children. Her goals in life are to educate her children and have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like running an internet cafe.

Rosemarie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 44 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rogelio Rojas

texts.es:
Rogelio Rojas con 44 años de edad,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Rogelio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rogelio Rojas, 44, lives in his own rustic house with his wife and children in the Pomahuaca district of the province of Jaén, which is in the Cajamarca region of Peru. He relies on good references, both personal and work-related, from area residents. The people in this area make a living mostly from agriculture, trade and livestock.

Rogelio makes a living in agriculture, specifically coffee farming, with 10 years of experience. This loan will be used for farming tasks, the incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest. It will help improve his crops and the timeliness of the harvest so that he will have greater production, better quality, and no problems with selling his product.

Rogelio is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: with farming tasks, the use of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 54 years old. He lives in the Chba Ampov district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He has two sons and three daughters. Two of his children are married, one works for a casino, one is a garment factory worker, and the last still young.

Sophal has worked as a car driver for nine years. He applied for a loan to replace the old motorbike that he uses to drive to work every day.

loans.use: replace the old motorbike that he takes to work.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Michel is 31 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Michel has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Michel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sunly

texts.en:
Sunly is 41 years old and a mother of five children who are in school. She lives in a house in Kampong Thom province. She grows rice to support her family’s living and is able to get additional income by raising pigs. The rice crop is not growing well since it was threatened by insects, which is the main challenge for her farming business.

This is her first loan with VisionFund and she is requesting a loan to pay for school fees for her son, who is pursuing a bachelor's degree in Accounting. She hopes this loan will enable her son to get a higher education and pave the way for him to get a good job.

loans.use: to pay for school fees to support the education of her her son, who is pursuing a bachelor's degree in accounting.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows coffee and other crops. Her primary customers are locals. 

Her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy water pipes to connect water to her farm. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business.

loans.use: to buy water pipes to bring water to her farm

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson makes a good living from his farming in Calamba, Misamis Occidental province, in the Philippines. This is how he supports his family and is able to send his children to school. 

He wants to increase his farm yield, especially because he has a high cost of living. 

Wilson approached Paglaum to lend enough to purchase bags of fertilizer and insecticides. He has high hopes that he will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married, with eight children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm, where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. 

She has been in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to add more cows. 

Her business goal is to have a largescale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add more dairy cows.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married, with six children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a carpentry business, where he makes furniture. 

He has been in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. 

His biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of carpentry materials. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is married, with eight children. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. 

She has been in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are locals. 

Her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other business outlets.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway’s sacrifices such as back pain, blurring eyes, exhaustion and hunger due to many years of tailoring all paid off when her children finished their college degrees. She and her husband, Walterio, were able to fulfill their responsibilities to their children by running a tailoring business and renting out rooms in their house.

Because Liwayway’s back already aches and her eyes blur when she’s on her sewing machine, she made available a portion of their house in Batasan Hills, Quezon City for tenants. With this additional income, she can continue to provide for her and her husband’s daily needs. From time to time she still works on her sewing machine because it’s the job that she knows and she needs to save money for emergency needs.

Liwayway was able to access several loans from CCT and Kiva in the past, and she's very grateful for it. She's been faithful in her repayments. This time she is imploring your kind generosity again in the amount of PHP 20,000. She will use it to renovate a portion of her house to make it conducive for tenants. She will also buy cloth, thread, and tailoring supplies.

She prays for good health, long life, and spiritual growth with her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: make renovations so she can rent out part of her house and to buy cloth, thread, and tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia Rosa

texts.es: Cecilia es una confeccionista reconocida en una localidad del municipio de Cartagena por su pulcritud para el diseño y calidad en las costuras, a sus 51 años de edad es viuda y  madre de dos hijos mayores de edad a quienes les solventó sus necesidades con su negocio. Cecilia ha dedicado toda una vida a la confección de ropa, por más de 30 años sus vecinos, conocidos, amigos y referidos han tenido el privilegio de solicitar la elaboración de diferentes prendas con la certeza de obtener un excelente trabajo.  Como se aproxima una temporada de gran demanda, Cecilia realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas, botones, correderas e hilos, necesarios para atender los requerimientos de su clientela. Cecilia es una mujer comprometida con su negocio y su principal meta es mantenerlo, es por ello que su servicio y calidad es inigualable.
texts.en:
Cecilia is tailor in an area of the city of Caragena who is known for her exquisite design and the quality of her sewing.  At age 51, she is a window and the mother of two adult children who she provided for through her business.  Cecilia has made a living making clothes for her entire life.  For more than 30 years, her neighbors, acquaintances, friends, and people who have been referred to her have had the privilege of ordering different items of clothing that they can be certain will be quality work.  

As she is approaching a season where she has a lot of demand, Cecilia requested a loan from Kiva as an opportunity to link up with financial success through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy the fabric, buttons, zippers, and thread necessary to fill orders for her customers.  Cecilia is a woman who is devoted to her business and her principal goal is to maintain it, therefore her service and quality of her work is without equal.

loans.use: to buy the fabric, buttons, zippers, and string necessary to fill orders for her customers.

loans.name: Bagdagul

texts.ru: Багдагуль успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Багдагуль на сегодня есть 3 коровы, 40 овец. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, вновь она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Багдагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также она хочет дать достойное образование ее внучке.
texts.en: Bagdagul successfully repaid her loan, after using it as intended. She is very grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Today, Bagdagul's farm contains 3 cows and 40 sheep. To continue developing her business, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount. Bagdagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and also wants to provide her granddaughter with a decent education.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 32 года, она замужем, мама 4 детей. У Гульмиры высшее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством - полеводством. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Гульмиры - 20,000 сом (KGS). В этом году она планирует закончить строительство дома, поэтому и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Доходы бизнеса Гульмира планирует вложить в будущее увеличение своего хозяйства и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Gulmira is 32 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. Gulmira has a college education and is involved in agriculture, specifically farming. She grows corn for sale on 1.0 hectare of land. Gulmira's monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). She is planning to finish building her house this year and, therefore, requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy construction materials. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from her business into the future growth of her farm and housing improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny, 58, is a farmer and a mother of seven children, one of whom is dependent on her. Living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, she has been raising ducks to earn income to support her family for 10 years. Her business helps her earn about $4 per day. She saves around $2 per day after her expenses.

She is now requesting a new loan with VisionFund to save her business. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy duck feed to improve her duck-raising business and make it run more smoothly than before. This will be her tenth loan. Her past loans, which were fully repaid, enabled her to support her family’s needs. She hopes to get additional income and upgrade her lifestyle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase duck feed so her duck-raising business can run more smoothly.

loans.name: Gulbar

texts.ru: Гулбар, 65 лет, вдова, 5 детей. Гулбар на пенсии, также занимается животноводством. Около 30 лет назад, она начала бизнес в сфере животноводства. На сегодняшний день у нее есть одна корова, а ее среднемесячный совокупный доход составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи, поэтому Гулбар обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулбар развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Gulbar is 65 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Gulbar is retired and also involved in animal husbandry. She started her animal husbandry business approximately 30 years ago. Today, she has one cow, and her combined monthly income amounts up to 25,000 som (KGS). Because this money is not enough to support her family, Gulbar requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 2 cows and increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will enable Gulbar to grow her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to invest in her business and increase her income

loans.name: Lahna

texts.en:
Lahna has been working in the leather industry for more than ten years. After being employed for several years, she decided to open her own factory four years ago in an industrial area of Beirut.

She is now 46 years old, married, and living with her husband and their four children. While her husband runs the factory with her, her two sons work in a jewelry shop, and her daughters still go to school.

Lahna makes women's clothes and bags in her factory and is confronted with high demand between autumn and winter. Also, in order to increase her sales and income, she deals with retailers who distribute her products in the area.

Lahna needs a 2,827,840 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will be using the loan to buy large quantities of leather in order to benefit from a discounted price, which will increase her profitability. Also, as her business expands, Lahna will be needing more workers in the factory, which should create job opportunities for the youth in the area.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of leather for making clothes and bags.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta, 58 years old, is a farmer from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 adult-aged children. She is borrowing various loans from Paglaum MPC to start up the next cropping season. Loreta is taking out a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a Kiva borrower who operates a farm where he grows tea and keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. Julius' primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. Julius will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is married, with three children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. 

She has been in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have more variety of products within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is married and has three children. He describes himself to be honest. For the past ten years, Martin has operated a farm where he keeps dairy cows and grows crops. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. Martin describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is Martin's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add one dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia wants to increase her rice production. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 60 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Narcisa has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, 48 years old, is known in the Calamba area for her fishing business. She actively participates in the various programs and services that the coop offers.

Zenaida applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks because she hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is married and has four children. He describes himself to be ambitious. For the past ten years, Julius has operated a retail business selling soap, bread, sugar, soda, flour and other items. His primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. Julius will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, soda and other items. He hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, soda and other items.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married, with two children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been in this business for four years. 

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.  Her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, soap, and other items. 

Her business goal is to have a big supermarket within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She says she will use the anticipated profits to start a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, soap, and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married, with four children. She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. 

Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge as Inadequate working capital. 

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jerusa

texts.en: Jerusa is married and has five children. For the past seven years, she has operated a retail business selling sugar, bread, soap, flour, milk and other items. Her primary customers are locals. Jerusa describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. Jerusa hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fima works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Fima is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy foods such as fish, meat, vegetables, and other supplies for her restaurant business.

Fima has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy foods such as fish, meat, vegetables, and other supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married, with three children. He describes himself as visionary. 

He operates a retail business, where he sells clothes. He has been in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which hurts business. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. 

His business goal is to have a business premise within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living conditions. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Carmen Veronica

texts.es:
Carmen es una señora de 33 años, vive junto a su pequeña hija en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, localidad conocida en el país porque por ser poseedora de maravillosos lugares, por su hidrografía y por el intercambio cultural que existe.
Carmen es madre muy trabajadora, desde muy temprano acude a su trabajo, tiene el cargo de centralista en una compañía de taxis, lleva ya varios años al servicio de esta empresa; comenta que no es fácil porque en ocasiones tiene que hacer turno y salir por las madrugadas a cumplir con sus funciones, aun a pesar de las malas noches ella es una señora muy responsable y más aún cuando se tiene una hija comenta.
Desde hace tres años fue madre, no ha sido fácil sacar sola adelante a su pequeña, por lo que tiene que trabajar muy duro por su bienestar, gracias a su madre que la cuida ella puede salir a la empresa. Carmen como toda madre responsable tiene un sueño, verla superar a su hija, por ello desde hace varios meses atrás ha tenido un sueño de emprender en su propio negocio para contar con otra fuente de ingresos y poder luego darle la educación a su hija, por ello con este crédito y unos pequeños ahorros iniciará su negocio de venta de ropa, al cual lo dedicará en horas libres de trabajo y los fines de semana. Se siente feliz y muy agradecida con KIVA, ya que es su primer crédito y aún más cuando lo va a invertir en algo que la ayudará a progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 33 year old woman who lives with her young daughter in Santo Domingo city, a place known for its marvelous places, bodies of water and for its cultural exchange.

Carmen is a hardworking mother who goes to work very early. She is a telephone operator in a taxi cab company. She has worked there for various years and she says that it is not easy because some times she need to work shifts and from there go very early in the morning to take care of her responsibilities. Even after having some tough nights, she is a very responsible woman and, "even more when you have a daughter" she says. She became a mother three years ago and it has not been easy to raise her daughter. This is why she has to work very hard, for her well-being. Thanks to her mother who helps care for her daughter, she can go to work.

Carmen, as any responsible mother has a dream, to see her daughter succeed. Because of this, and for various months now, she dreams of starting her own business, to have another source of income and be able to provide her daughter with an education. With this loan and some small savings, she will start a business selling clothes. She will do this in her free time from work and during the weekends. She feels happy and is very thankful to KIVA since this is her first loan and more so because she will invest in something that will help her improve and get ahead.

loans.use: to start her own business selling clothes and this way, make her dream come true, to be independent, succeed and spend more time with her daughter.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is married, with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lily is 52 years old, and she has four children in school.

Lily has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lily has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
With wide farming experience, Myrna has mastered activities such as growing, caring for and harvesting her crop as well as earning income. She helps support her husband's efforts by doing this type of work.

Myrna has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs and recently requested a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

Someday, Myrna hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate in order to add income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a married mother of one, describes herself as committed. She has been operating a farm where she grows coffee for five now years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are coffee millers. She describes her biggest challenge as inadequate working capital.

Grace will use this Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs to increase production. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards. Grace's business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as loyal. He operates a retail business where he sells potatoes. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more potatoes to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to add a variety of products in the business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Lyalda

texts.en:
Lyalda is 54 years old and married with four children.

Lyalda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread, and other snack foods.

Lyalda has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from an E-loading station.

Lyalda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread, and other snack foods

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: In the year 2009, Virgilio learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Virgilio feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next planting season. Virgilio wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, a married father of four, describes himself as patient. For four years he has operated a retail business where he sells clothes, shoes and bags. His primary customers are locals. His biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

His previous loans with SMEP Microfinance Bank repaid, Thomas has requested his third one for Kes 100,000 to buy more stocks of clothes, shoes and bags. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción con 56 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, el cuál se encuentra de 04 y 06 años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar, así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola. El destino del crédito será para invertir en los gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de café. De está manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Asunción es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,este es su cuarto crédito.
texts.en:
Asuncion, 56, is married and lives with his wife and children in Cañaris, in Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque, Peru. He has excellent personal and professional references from people who live in the area. The residents of this area mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee; his plants are now between 4 and 6 years old, and he has around ten years of experience. He also grows vegetables and works as a field hand. The loan will be used to pay for fertilizers and maintenance for his coffee crop. In this way it will have a better yield and he will improve his living standard.

Asuncion is a repeat borrower for Edpyme Alternativa, this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers and maintaining his coffee fields.

loans.name: Segundo Santos

texts.es:
Segundo Santos con 37 años de edad ,de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos , en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de la variedad Catimor, sembrando 1 hectárea de café de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio el Arenal del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 16 años y hace 4 años al cultivo de café. Adicionalmnente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Segundo Santos es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Segundo Santos is 37 years old and married. He lives in his own home made of rustic materials, along with his wife and their four children. This is in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region of Peru. He has great references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area.

He earns a living through agriculture, specifically growing the Catimor variety of coffee. He plants one hectare of his land with coffee. His land is located in Caserio el Arenal in the Santo Tomas de Cutervo district. He has 16 years experience in the field, and 4 years experience in coffee farming.

He also earns a living through breeding and selling small animals, and growing bread-making ingredients. The loan is to be invested in maintaining his crops, which will give him greater yield and better income so that he can improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his crops.

loans.name: Maria Erodita

texts.es:
María es una señora de 51 años, vive junto a su esposo y  a sus hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, un sector comercial del país y reconocido por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones de la sierra y costa, por esta ciudad es obligatorio que las regiones se junten por eso es muy comercial por el intercambio que existe.
María es una madre muy trabajadora, mientras sus hijos estudian ella aprovecha para dedicarle tiempo a su negocio, hace años atrás ella cría pollos en su casa, gracias a este pequeño negocio y al apoyo de su esposo quien también trabaja ha podido salir adelante con su familia, han podido adquirir su pequeña casa y darles la educación a sus pequeños.
María es clienta fidelizada de la institución, este ya es su segundo crédito, con el primero pudo fortalecer más su negocio, ahora ha podido mejorar el espacio donde tiene los animales. Con este actual crédito podrá comprar más pollos y balanceado porque es una muy buena época para invertir ya que se acerca los meses festivos donde consumen su producto.
Tanto ella como  su familia están agradecidos con KIVA por la ayuda que dan para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir superándose.
texts.en:
María is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children in the town of Santo Domingo.
