It is a commercial area of the country, and well-known for being the land bridge that links the mountains and the coast. It is compulsory in this town for the regions to join together, so it is very commercial due to the exchanges that take place there.

Maria is a very hard-working woman. While her children are in school she uses the time to work in her business. She has bred chickens in her home for years. Thanks to this small business and the support of her husband, who also works, she has been able to move her family forward. They have been able to get their own small house, and educate their children.

Maria is a loyal customer of the institution, she is already on her second loan. She was able to strengthen her business with the first loan, now she has improved the space where she keeps the animals. With this new loan she will be able to buy more chickens and balanced food for them. It is a very good time to invest as the festive months are getting closer when her product will be consumed.

Both Maria and her family are grateful to Kiva for the help that they have received to improve their quality of life and keep getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and balanced food for them, to make the most of custom in the approaching Christmas season.

loans.name: Piedad Jeaneth

texts.es:
Janeth es una señora de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, localidad conocida en el país porque habita la Etnia Tsáchila, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosos paisajes, por la etnia y por ser el puente terrestre que une a la sierra de la costa.
En este lugar vive Janeth, su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ha tocado trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al diseño de interiores y exteriores.  Janeth actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que lo inició hace varios años atrás siendo su madre su ejemplo a seguir. Trabaja todos los días por las tardes, pero su fuerte son los fines de semana donde visita a la mayoría de su clientela, también en ocasiones va a ferias de la ciudad.
Con este crédito podrá comprar más pantalones, blusas y ropa interior para surtir su negocio ya que es una muy buena época para  invertir porque la ciudad está de fiestas y es cuando la gente compra más sus productos.
Agradece a KIVA por apoyarle a seguir adelante, y en un futuro cercano ponerse un local y que este negocio siga fortaleciéndose para que a su familia no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Janeth is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Santo Domingo, a place that is well-known in the country because the ethnic group the Tsáchila live there. The area is known for its beautiful countryside, its ethnic groups, and for being the land bridge that joins the mountain range with the coast. Janeth, her husband, and her two children live there.

She is a very diligent woman whose destiny has been to work hard to support her family. She has the support of her husband, who works in interior and exterior design.

Currently, Janeth makes a living by selling clothes. She started the business several years back, with her mother as her example to follow. She works every day in the afternoon, but her mainstay are the weekends, when she visits the majority of her customers. She also sometimes goes to fairs in the city.

With this loan, she will be able to buy more pants, shirts, and underwear to stock her business. It is a very good time to invest because the city is in a season of celebration, which is when people buy her products most.

She thanks Kiva for supporting her as she moves forward, and in the near future, establishes a permanent storefront. She is thankful that this business continues to be strengthened so that her family lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy more pants, shirts, and underwear to stock her business, and in the future be able to establish a permanent storefront

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: María es una joven estudiante de Ingeniería Alimenticia en una universidad local, en sus ratos libre labora como Inspectora de calidad.lleva cinco años en esta carrera y se siente orgullosa de poder seguir estudiando sin preocupaciones  ya que el dinero que solicitó la ayudará mucho para cubrir los gastos de mensualidades y materiales que le piden, Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado y piden que sigan ayudando a muchos jóvenes que tienen ganas de estudiar y por falta de ayuda no pueden.
texts.en:
María is a young food science student at a local university. In her free time, she works as a quality inspector. She has been in the field for 5 years

She is proud to be able to continue going to school without worry, because the requested loan will be a lot of help to cover the monthly fees and materials required of her.

She thanks Kiva lenders for their support, and she asks that you continue helping the many young people who are motivated to study but cannot, due to lack of support.

loans.use: to cover monthly costs and study materials

loans.name: William Adalberto

texts.es: William tiene 20 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una unidad de transporte colectivo, lo que le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostener la economía de su familia. Él vive junto a su madre y hermanos en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años, él sabe que el esfuerzo de su madre para sacarlos adelante fue mucho por lo que siempre le brinda todo su apoyo. William desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para ello, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la fosa séptica de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
William is 20 years old. He makes a living by offering his services in a transportation collective. This enables him to earn the necessary income to support his family economically.

He has lived for many years with his mother and brothers in a house they own. He knows that his mother put in a great amount of effort to support them, so he always gives her all of his support.

William wants to build a septic tank at his house because he doesn't have a proper space for it. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron in order to build his house's septic tank as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build his house's septic tank

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can request financial assistance for her chosen business. Marianita has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Marianita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Ramira

texts.en: Ramira is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 56 years old, married, and has a corn-production business in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. Recently, Ramira requested a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climate changes. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to own better breeds of cows within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself as polite. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. He will use the anticipated profits to increase the capital base of the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Chaka

texts.en: Chaka is a married man. He has five children. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells auto spare parts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased profits and better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to a buy variety of spices to sell in the market for her business buying and selling spices.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell in the market.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan which she has paid well. She used the loan to buy foodstuffs, e.g., flour, sugar, salt and cooking fat and thus increased the stock of her general retail store. This enabled her to meet the demands of her customers, thus increasing sales.

Besides the general store, she also practices mixed farming to supplement her income. She does poultry and crop farming. She has applied for an additional Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and poultry feeds to boost production of her farming activities. She says that this will help her get more income to pay education fees for her child.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the continued financial support. She promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and poultry feeds to boost production of farming activities and earn more income to support her child's education.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en: Anderson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, salt, spices, soap, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock  of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a productive business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock  of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a married man. He has five children. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to boost business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, bags, and clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, clothes, bags and other items. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, clothes, bags.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is juggling managing her business and supervising the renovation of their home. Lydia hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Lydia has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all of her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en: Frankline is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as creative. He operates a retail business where he sells watches and mobile phone accessories. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy more stock of watches and other items. His business goal is to have a watch company within five years. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watches and other items.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a farm where he grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a fertile area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a dairy cow, upgrade his cow shed, and buy other farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, upgrade his cow shed, and buy other farm inputs.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en: Dzine is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a better business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other items

loans.name: Ma. Mardy

texts.en:
Ma. Mardy is 38 years old, single and has one child.

Ma. Mardy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Mardy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Mardy has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Mardy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Carmen Soler Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Carmen Soler, está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde se encuentran esforzando por mejorar y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela, una humilde vendedora de comidas, comenta que ella misma se encarga de hacer las comidas que vende, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día a través del  trabajo unido.
La Sra. Mariela solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas para la venta, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por mejorar y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is called Carmen Soler, and it is currently in the second cycle of the program Committee for Women in which everyone works and helps each other in order to move ahead.  They are conducting a survey on the eradication of poverty and making efforts to improve and grow.  One of its members is Mariela, a humble food vendor.  According to her, she cooks food which she sells and those sales provide her with the means to help her loved ones. She is thankful for the opportunity she is given to grow and improve each day, through team work. 

Mariela requests a loan to buy goods to cook food for sale such as meat, seasoning, baked products, vegetables and others.  In that way, she can continue maintaining her sales and making efforts to fulfill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook food for sale such as, meat, seasoning, baked goods, and vegetables among others.

loans.name: Flor De Patuju Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 57 años de edad, soltera, tiene hijos mayores de edad, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería.
Ella es constante, paciente y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘villa primero de mayo’ ciudad que emergió en medio del monte de calles arenosas de precarias casas, habitadas por humildes familias.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro y baja estatura (la tercera de la izquierda, viste blusa celeste), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su hijo menor que es mayor de edad e independiente, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Actualmente tomó las riendas de la banca y se encarga de la presidencia para continuar trabajando con la institución, la anterior presidenta dejó la banca por motivos de salud. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería como, cuadernos, lápices, bolígrafos, pegamento, reglas y otros, “vendo libros escolares y todo los que utilizan los niños…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra bien ubicado y las ventas son frecuentes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio continuamente. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para tener más clientes, ella desea comprar material escolar surtido. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar material escolar surtido para abastecer su librería.
texts.en:
Maria is a 57 year old woman, single and with three adult children, who works selling stationery.

She is reliable, patient and very friendly. She runs her business in the "Villa Primero de Mayo" neighbourhood, a town in the hills with sandy streets of makeshift houses filled with poor families.

Maria is short, with a dark complexion and black hair (third from the left, wearing sky blue). Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish within the general culture and for work. She shares her life with her youngest son, who is an independent adult. They live in a rented brick room with safe drinking water, electric power and sewage services. She recently took the reins of the bank and was put in charge of the presidency. The previous president left the bank for health reasons.

She works selling stationery items such as notebooks, pencils, pens, glue, rulers, etc. "I sell school books and everything children use," she says. The advantage of her business is that it has a good location and frequent sales. The disadvantage is her lack of capital with which to keep supplying her business. Her dream is to expand her business to have more customers. She wants to buy assorted school supplies. This is her second loan from the institution in her 4 years of this activity. For these reasons, Maria is requesting a loan to buy various school supplies to stock her stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy various school supplies to stock her stationery shop.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself as persuasive. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 63 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fruit and vegetable stand in the local market to earn a living. She has been in this business for many years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits to sell in the market. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient salon items.

She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open other business outlets within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Ruphence

texts.en: Ruphence is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of meat. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to do farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en: Erastus is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to renovate the restaurant. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: Eliecer David

texts.es:
Eliecer es un hombre de 34 años de edad vivien con la madre de los hijos tiene tres. El se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz, ademas cria animales como gallina el credito necesita para la comprar de fertilizantes, abonos y alimento para las gallinas.

El con el credito ha crecido en la produccion y sus ganancias han sido muy buenas, el sueño de Elicer es tener dinero para comprar terrenos y seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Eliecer is 34 years old and lives with the mother of his three children. He works as a farmer, growing corn and rice. He also raises animals, such as chickens. He needs this loan to buy fertilizer and chicken feed.

His previous loan allowed him to increase production and make a very good profit. Elicer's goal is to have enough money to buy plots of land and continue growing more crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Olga Abigail

texts.es:
Olga tiene 21 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Olga se dedica en la actualidad a la venta de legumbres puesto que siembra papas, ocas a demas tiene uno que otro animalito pero el credito lo solicita para la compra de estans para poner la mercaderia ademas necesita comprar algunas cosas para arreglar la tienda.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia con los hernamos y los padres
texts.en:
Olga is 21 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with some of her relatives in the city of Guaranda, Bolívar province.

Olga is now working selling vegetables she grows, like potatoes and oca [an Andean tuber]. She also has one or two animals, but she is requesting the loan to buy shelves to show her products, and some things she needs for her store.

She likes to spend her free time with her family, with her siblings and her parents.

loans.use: to buy shelves to show her products, and some things she needs for her store.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as fruits, sugar, oil, and other supplies.

Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as fruits, sugar, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Mae

texts.en:
Maria Mae is a 30-year-old married woman and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maria Mae has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Maria Mae requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits like banana, sweet potato, etc. to sell to her local market.

Maria Mae has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like banana, sweet potato, etc. to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Sulfise

texts.fr: Sulfise est âgée de 51 ans. Veuve, elle a six enfants dont 4 sont entièrement sous sa responsabilité. Depuis la mort de son mari, elle a mis sur pied une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires. Le crédit l’aide à faire progresser l’activité.
texts.en: Sulfise is a 51-year-old widow.  She has had six children, four of whom are entirely under her care.  Since her husband's death, she has started a small retail business and she now sells food products.  She will use her loan to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Arnolys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arnolys tiene 46 años y es una mujer felizmente casada. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en el municipio de Cerete, en la costa colombiana. Su familia es toda su vida, razón por la cual siempre está concentrada en buscar formas de darles la mejor calidad de vida que le sea posible. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de comenzar su propio negocio.

Aprovechando su talento para las manualidades ha decidido comenzar su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de accesorios de acero, algo que ella misma aprendió hacer y que ahora va a explorar profesionalmente. Por su falta de capital necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar acero y herramientas para la elaboración de los accesorios. 

Arnolys está dispuesta a trabar duro para lograr grandes cosas con su negocio, es una mujer responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su hogar para que su familia viva mejor. Ayuda a esta devota mujer a cumplir sus sueños, un préstamo la llevará más cerca de esto.
texts.en:
Arnolys is 46 years old and she is a happily married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in the Cerete municipality on the coast of Colombia. Her family is everything to her, and for this reason she is always concentrating on finding ways to give them the best quality of life possible. 
For this reason she has decided to begin her own business. Taking advantage of her talent in making handicrafts, she has decided to begin her own business making and selling accessories made of steel. She learned how to do this on her own and is now going to explore this professionally. 
Because of her lack of capital, she needs a loan to purchase steel and tools to create the accessories. 
Arnolys is willing to work hard in order to achieve great things with her business. She is a responsible woman with a great desire to get ahead and give the best to her family. 
Help this devoted woman accomplish her dreams - a loan will get her closer to this.

loans.use: to purchase steel and tools to produce accessories.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Antony. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He does mango farming to earn a living. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, he has acquired skills in enterprise development, financial management, savings, and resource mobilization. He has been able to improve his farming. The quality output from his farm has enabled him to earn more profits, which has enabled him to meet family needs with ease.

Antony is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand his farming by buying manure and pesticide. He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticide that will boost his farming.

loans.name: Renato

texts.es:
Renato es un hombre de 33 años de edad, soltero, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de colchones.
Él es independiente, honesto y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘cupesi de los reyes’ caracterizado por albergar a los sobrevivientes de la riada producto del desborde del río años atrás, hoy surge como el área de mayor producción manufacturera y comercio en general. De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Renato es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de colchones de resorte, actividad que aprendió trabajando como ayudante en una fábrica de colchones, “el colchón debe durar muchos años, para eso el alambre de acero de los resortes debe ser bueno…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus colchones son baratos y cuenta con ventas continuas, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar la producción. Su sueño es tener una fábrica grande de colchones, él desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar la fabricación de colchones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza eta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Renato solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para fabricar colchones.
texts.en:
Renato is a 33-year-old man. He is single and has two children, 5 and 10 years old. His business is manufacturing mattresses.

He is independent, honest and very hard-working. He operates his business in the "Cupesi de los Reyes" neighborhood, which is known for having welcomed the survivors of the flood several years ago when the river rose above its banks. Today the area is booming as the most active center of manufacturing and trade in general. The climate is tropical and very humid.

Renato has brown skin and short black hair and is short in stature. His native language is Guaraní, which he speaks with his family. He also speaks Spanish thanks to the general culture and the business he operates. He shares his life with his children, who are attending school. They live in a rented room built of brick which has drinking water, sewer and electricity connections.

His business is manufacturing spring mattresses. He learned this skill while working as an assistant in a mattress factory. "The mattresses should last for a long time, so the steel wire of the springs must be good," he comments. The advantage of his business is that his mattresses are inexpensive and he has continuous sales. The disadvantage is the lack of an industrial sewing machine to improve production. His dream is to have a large mattress factory. He wants to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve his mattress manufacturing business. This is his first loan sequence during the one year he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Renato is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to manufacture mattresses.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to produce mattresses.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: La vivienda de Ricardo carece de muchas mejoras, pero en ella vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 20, 17, 14 y 11 años de edad a los que cuida con mucho cariño. Él tiene 45 años de edad y desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de ganado bovino, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. El área del lavadero de Ricardo necesita de muchas mejoras, tanto en el techo como la pila que tiene algunas fugas de agua, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, lámina y polines para reparar el área del lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo's house is in need of many repairs, but he lives in it with his wife and their four children, aged 20, 17, 14 and 11 who they happily care for. He is 45 years old and for the last 20 years he has earned a living through trading cattle. This job allows him to provide for his family.

The laundry area in Ricardo's house needs a lot of improvements, both to the ceiling and the sink where there are some water leaks. This is why he is asking for a loan with FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, sheets of metal and beams to repair the laundry area of his home.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, sheets of metal and beams to repair the laundry area in his home.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc -Mototaxistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC -MOTOTAXISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Lino tiene 49 años de edad es soltero y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a prestar servicio de transporte, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para comprar llantas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito  y se comprometen  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Sr. De Torrechayoc-Mototaxistas. This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, a part of the Urubamba province and the Cusco region.

The member LIno is 49 years old, single, and has 2 children. The member alternates his daily activities by offering transportation services. The member has worked for a long time in this business, which is going well for him thanks to the determination that he applies to business every day. The member is a diligent and responsible person, and these qualities allow him to provide for his family.

The member is applying for a loan to buy tires.

The other members work in agriculture, selling clothes, taxi services, and managing a grocery store.

The members are very grateful for the loan and promise to make all their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila has mastered her hog-raising business in Calamba. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to request credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care of her hog-raising business so she does with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always go there for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 5,000 will help her build a concrete pigpen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pigpen.

loans.name: Reagan

texts.en: Reagan is a married man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to service and maintain his tuk tuk. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to boost business.

loans.use: to service and maintain his tuk tuk

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a  Kiva borrower. She has eight children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of goods. She will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build a premises for her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cashew nuts. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Arlalaine

texts.en:
Arlalaine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlalaine is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Arlalaine has a business buying and selling condiments in the Philippines. Arlalaine requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of condiments to sell.

Arlalaine has been in this business for three years. In the future, Arlalaine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of condiments to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Candelaria is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Candelaria has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Candelaria requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Candelaria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Candelaria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Yenifer Xiomara

texts.es:
Yenifer, de 20 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudio hasta octavao, actualmente vive junto con pareja y su hija; su pareja se dedica a la pesca artesanal.

Yenifer, trabaja en la planta de empacado de pescado en la playa y de esa manera ayuda con los gastos de su familia.

Yenifer, necesita el préstamo para comprar redes para que su pareja siga trabajando en la pesca, porque esto contribuye a generar mejores ingresos al núcleo familia.

El sueño de Yenifer, es poder comprar una lancha propia, porque en la que el esposo trabaja es arrendada.
texts.en:
Yenifer, 20 years old, is a very hardworking woman who studied until eighth grade.  She currently lives with her partner and her daughter.  Her partner works as a small-scale fisherman.
Yenifer has worked for three years at a packing plant at the beach, and in that way she helps to cover the family expenses. 

Yenifer needs a loan to buy fishing nets so that her partner continues to work in the fishing industry, as this helps to create a better income for the whole family.  Yenifer's dream is to be able to buy her own boat as the one her husband works with is rented.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets so that her partner continues to work in the fishing industry

loans.name: William Boanerge

texts.es:
William, de 32 años de edad, estudio quinto grado, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos.

William, tiene una pequeña venta de lácteos desde hace dos años, pero también se dedica a la crianza de especies menores; el compra y vende ganado para generar más ingresos. 

William, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado, porque pronto cortará el pasto y eso le servirá de alimento para engordar el ganado.

William, sueña con tener más ganado y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
William is 32 years old and studied up to Grade 5. He has always worked in agriculture. He is in a relationship and has 3 kids.

William has had a small dairy operation for two years and he also works raising small animals. He buys and sells cattle to generate more income.

William needs the loan to buy cattle as he is about to cut his pasture and this will serve as food to fatten the cattle.

William dreams of having more cattle and getting his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nou Tout Pou Viv

texts.en:
Janitha is a poor woman who lives in Leogane, a district in Port-au-Prince. Leogane is known as an historic place where a woman, "Anacaona", led this countryside to prosperity and cultural riches (poetry, songs) in the fifteenth century.

Janitha's role in that community follows the same path. Like many Zafen borrowers, she is the leader of a group. Her economic activity helps her pay school fees for her only child and to save for her rent. Had Janitha more money, she would make more profits in foodstuffs retailing.

Janitha is used to supporting 26 women in her neighborhood about literacy. She hopes to find an additional investment in Zafen to support those women and alleviate poverty.

Portrayed from left to right: Yrlande (red-patterned blouse) is the treasurer of the group, Francky (short-sleeved shirt) keeps the book; Janitha wears a necklace and she is the coordinator.Denise wears a miniskirt in the picture and she is an advisor.

loans.use: to buy more food products to retail.

loans.name: Las Barrarenas Group

texts.en:
Santa Bárbara Suchitepéquez, on the west coast of Guatemala, is the place with a hot climate and refreshing rains where the 7 women of Barrarenas group live. With an average age of 35 years, some of the ladies were able to study in primary school, and now the majority of them are married and, together with their spouses, providing education and a quality life for their children. 

Jobelina, who is 54 years old, studied only to the first grade before she had to help her family in their home and with their work. Now, she is mother of 5 children. A widow of 4 years, Jobelina is a strong and determined woman, working and gaining income to survive and support her family on her own. She runs a convenience store and snack business, selling fruit smoothies, tamales, and other delicious, warm and cold, Guatemalan snack foods. On the weekends, she sells meals, such as chile rellenos, and meat prepared traditionally and served with rice, vegetables, and tortillas. In addition to this work, Jobelina also raises pigs. With the loan she is requesting she would like to buy more products to re-stock her store, expand her sales and businesses, as well as some chickens and corn.

To bring income to their families, these ladies from Barrarenas group run a variety of businesses, selling snacks, managing convenience stores, selling corn and other produce, producing and selling firewood, maintaining tortillerías, and raising animals such as pigs and chickens. They are excited to begin with credits and expand their businesses, moving ahead with confidence and hope.

loans.use: to buy more products to re-stock her store, expand her sales and businesses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de jugos y licuados desde hace mas de 7 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de frutas, naranjas, azucar, hielo, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Daniel is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has worked in the sale of juices and smoothies for the past 7 years. His business is located in his place of residence and he has many customers. With his earnings he has been able to pay some of his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fruits, oranges, sugar and ice, among other things, and in that way be able to continue his sales in order to make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fruits, oranges, sugar, ice, among other things.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socio pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGRO DE URUBAMBA” , ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba en la  región del Cusco.

La señora Isabel pertenece ala banco comunal, ella  es una persona trabajadora y sale adelante con su negocio de frutas, ella es muy dedicada  a su labor desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, ella expende sus productos.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar plátanos, manzana y papaya, para poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecerlos al público en general.
la fotografía de la socia que esta pegada en la foto grupal llego tarde por motivos de trabajo.

Los demás socios se dedican a dar servicio de moto taxi, actividad agrícola, y trabajar en instituciones públicas.
 Los socio agradecen a los inversionista de KIVA por confiar en ellos y darles el crédito que les ayudara a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "Señor de los milagros de Urubamba" communal bank, located in the Urubamba province, Cusco region.

Isabel is a member of this communal bank. She is a hardworking person who gets ahead selling fruits. She is devoted to her business, selling her products from 6:00 am until 4:00 pm.

She requested a loan to buy bananas, apples, and papayas, to expand her business and offer everyone her products.

The member whose picture is attached to the original group picture arrived late because she had to work. The remaining members have different activities, such as a driving a mototaxi, working in agriculture, and working for the government.

The members are grateful to Kiva lenders for trusting in them, and giving them the loan, which will help them to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, and papayas.

loans.name: Elinor

texts.en:
Elinor is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She also runs a motorcycle transport business where she has employed someone to transport customers from one place to another. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be breakdown of machines.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another sewing machine and repair the motorcycle. Her business goal is to have at least five sewing machines within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and repair the motorcycle

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Melan

texts.en: Melan has started her small-time business and become a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she makes good sales since hers is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en: Kahaso is a Kiva borrower. She has seven children. She operates a retail business where she sells jikos (stoves), open shoes, and plastic containers. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and she has regular customers. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of jikos, open shoes, and plastic containers. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jikos (stoves), open shoes, and plastic containers.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita is a hardworking mother from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Zita has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Zita hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of fresh products. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier of vegetables to other retailers within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a retail business where he sells soap, sugar, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will open a supermarket. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour,salt and other items

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a favourable place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Marco Antonio es natural de Sud Cinti, vive en Tarija hace 15 años, es técnico en Mecánica de motocicletas y su proyecto es equipar y mejorar su taller mecánico de Motos, requiere de recursos para surgir con sus proyectos que tiene, cuenta con la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para poder surgir en este negocio, es así que cuenta con un certificado de la escuela de motociclistas "EMM".
El cliente tiene tres hijos a quienes brinda su apoyo moral y económico, vive en condición de alquilado, son de condición humilde, pero se pudo apreciar que es una familia unida y que juntos han podido salir adelante con sus proyectos; todo esto con el fin de poderles brindar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
El Sr. Marco indica tener mucha pasión por el trabajo que realiza y requiere el préstamo para poder crecer en lo que hace.
En tanto su esposa es ama de casa y quien colabora en la educación de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Marco is a native of Sud Cinti, He has lived in Tarija for 15 years. He is an expert motorcycle mechanic and his project is to furnish and improve his repair shop. He needs resources to move forward with his projects. He has experience and the necessary knowledge in order to stand out in this business. He has a certificate from the motorcycle school “EMM”.

This client has three children to whom he provides moral and financial support. He lives in humble, rented conditions. He was able to appreciate that they are a united family and that together, they have been able to get ahead with their projects. All of this has the goal of being able to provide his children with a better quality of life.

Marco notes that he is very passionate in the work he does and he needs the loan in order to grow what he does.

His wife takes care of the home and helps with the education of his young children.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work as a motorcycle mechanic.

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en: Kahaso is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She also owns a beauty salon. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells rice, sugar, flour, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, eggs, bread and other items.

His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business and cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, eggs, bread and other items

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel es una mujer de 33 años de edad una persona trabajadora luchadora, es casada y tiene dos princesas de 5 y 10, su principal dificultad radica en el cuidado de sus hijos, en muchas ocasiones tiene que salirse de trabajar por estar pendiente de ellas, esto le ha traído irregularidades económicas puesto que necesitan de sus ingresos para tener una buena calidad de vida.
La mejor solución que encuentra la cliente es emprender un negocio, ella siempre ha tenido gusto por los pasteles, quiere capacitarse y montar un repostería a futuro, pero quiere hacerlo todo paso a poso.
Solicita un préstamo para pagar un curso de bizcochos y cubiertas dictado por la corporación Interactuar, busca los conocimientos y la certificación, para iniciar a operar desde su hogar.
texts.en:
Anabel is a 33 year old woman. She is a hardworking person who is a fighter. She is married and has two princesses, aged 5 and 10. Her main difficulty is caring for her children. May times she has to leave work to care for them and this has brought her financial irregularity since they need her income to have a good quality of life.

The best solution she has found is to start a business. She has always liked pastries. She wants to train and open a pastry bakery in the future, but she wants to do it step by step.

She is asking for a loan to pay for a course in cakes and icings held by Corporación Interactuar. She is seeking knowledge and certification to start operating from her home.

loans.use: pay a course of biscuits and toppings (pastry)

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz es una emprendedora mujer de 24 años, madre de tres hijos con los que reside en el municipio de San Jacinto y en compañía de su cónyuge les aportan bienestar por medio de los recursos que consiguen con su trabajo.  Ella se dedica a la venta de mercancías varias, alimentos y accesorios para motocicletas; esta última actividad la inició con el apoyo de un amigo que es distribuidor de repuestos y accesorios, quien le suministra los encargos que le realizan sus clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años en su negocio con muy buenos resultados y está muy feliz de pasar tiempo con sus hijos para que sean criados según sus costumbres, principios y valores.  Luz se proyecta a futuro con un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos e incrementar sus ventas, ella considera que solo podrá hacer realidad su sueño de prosperidad con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio,  y una forma de acercarse a esta meta es incrementando su capital de trabajo, por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con los recursos que recibirá comprará repuestos y accesorios de motos, carnes frías, enseres para el hogar y demás encargos de sus clientela. Esta inversión será de éxito y su familia será la principal beneficiada.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising 24 year old woman and mother of three children who lives in the town of San Jacinto. With her husband they support themselves through the living they make from their work.

She makes a living from selling various goods such as food and accessories for motorcycles; the latter activity was started with the support of a friend who is a distributor of parts and accessories and who supplied her with orders from his clients. She has run her business for five years with very good results.

She is happy to spend time with her children in order that they will be raised according to her customs, principles and values. Luz sees a future with a store where she can showcase her products and increase sales. She believes she will only be able to realize her dream of prosperity with hard work and sacrifice.

One way to achieve this goal is to increase her working capital and she therefore made an application for a Kiva loan which is an opportunity to access finance through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the resources that she receives she will buy spare parts and motorcycle accessories, cold meats, household items as well as other orders from her clientele.

This investment will be a success and her family will be the main beneficiary.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and motorcycle accessories, cold meats, household items as well as other orders from her clientele.

loans.name: Susana Graciela

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer trabajadora, madre de una hija de 21 años quién depende económicamente de ella. Tiene 39 años y vive actualmente en Guanajuato, en donde tiene su negocio.
Estudió la carrera técnica como estilista y hace ocho años decidió iniciar un negocio propio. Susana estableció un salón de belleza tras ver la oportunidad de trabajo que generaba y la satisfacción de atender a clientes haciendo lo que más le gusta.
Con el objetivo de mejorar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, Susana ha solicitado un crédito para realizar pagos a proveedores, así como para comprar más material y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con la idea de incrementar sus ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking woman, and the mother of a 21-year-old daughter who depends on her economically. She is 39 years old and lives in Guanajuato, where she has her business.

She is a licensed stylist, and eight years ago decided to start her own business. Susana opened a beauty salon after realizing how good opportunity it was and how satisfied she felt taking care of her clients and doing what she likes to do the most.

With the objective of improving and expanding her business, Susana has requested a loan to pay her suppliers, and buy more supplies to better serve her clients. The idea is to increase her sales to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her suppliers and buy more supplies.

loans.name: Jacqueline Estefania

texts.es:
Jacqueline es una joven de 24 años, vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de  Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Jacqueline  desde hace años atrás se ha dedicado a los negocios, aprendió desde joven gracias a su madre que es comerciante. Actualmente vende cosméticos y relojes, cuenta con clientela fija, se dedica por las mañanas a recorrer porque por las tarde Jacqueline es una alumna muy dedicada, se encuentra cursando la universidad ya a muy poco de obtener su título, por ello se ha esforzado mucho para poder pagarse los estudios con los ingresos que pueda obtener de sus negocios.
Es una joven muy carismática y dedicada, Jacqueline ya es clienta de la institución, con este crédito podrá seguir fortaleciendo su negocio en esta época donde comienza a subir las ventas, gracias a KIVA podrá seguir creciendo como microempresaria ganar más clientes y así poder seguir con sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a young woman aged 24. She lives with her mother in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados. For some years Jacqueline has worked in business, she learned from an early age thanks to her mother who is a businesswoman.

She currently sells cosmetics and watches and has regular customers. She works in the mornings because in the afternoons Jacqueline is a very hard-working student. She is attending university and is close to getting her degree. She has worked hard so she can pay for her studies with the income that she gets from her business.

She is a very charismatic and hard-working young woman. Jacqueline is already a client with the institution. With this loan she will be able to keep strengthening her business at a time when she is starting to increase sales. Thanks to Kiva she can keep growing as a micro business, earning more clients so she can continue with her futher education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and strengthen her business, so she can keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “ESPERANZA Y PROGRESO” está conformada por 06 socias trabajadoras. Este es el caso de Ana de 48 años de edad, soltera con 3 hijos 1 de ellos dependiente. Ana es una madre empeñosa con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas como pescado frito  ceviche Y picantes. Solicito el crédito para la compra de sillas mesas para que sus clientes estén más cómodos y puedan comer sus comidas cómodamente. El grupo “esperanza y progreso” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Ana es la primera del lado derecho se encuentra sentada y viste polo azul.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ESPERANZA Y PROGRESO” [Hope and Progress] is made up of 6 working members. This is the case of Ana, who is 48 years old, single, and has 3 kids, 1 of which is dependent. Ana is an diligent mother who wants to improve her quality of life. She works in the sale of food such as fried fish, ceviche, and spicy foods. She is requesting a loan to buy chairs and tables so her customers can be comfortable and can eat their food comfortably. 

The group "esperanza y progreso" [hope and progress] thanks Kiva for the help offered. Ana is the first one on right side sitting and wearing a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bedding. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic and competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bed sheets, mattress covers, and pillows. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bed sheets, mattress covers, and pillows

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will support his family financially. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improver his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo, localidad de la región costa, vive Carmen, una señora de 36 años, madre soltera que comparte con sus dos pequeñas.
Carmen es una madre muy trabajadora, actualmente cuenta con su pequeño taller de costura el mismo que lo tiene bien ubicado. Comenta que no fue fácil, pudo adquirir experiencia estudiando y además trabajando en talleres de la ciudad, tenía que sacrificar el tiempo de no estar con sus hijas para ir al trabajo y traer el sustento del hogar.
Carmen poco a poco pudo ir ahorrando y por ello está feliz porque desde casa puede seguir generando ingresos, tiene su taller donde cuenta con tres máquinas de coser y lo más primordial, tiene a sus pequeñas a su lado donde puede compartir con ellas.
Carmen es clienta de la institución, con su primer crédito compró más telas y una máquina de segunda, ahora desea seguir creciendo e incrementando su negocio, va a comparar otra máquina muy fundamental para su trabajo diario que es indispensable para avanzar más rápido con las prendas que realiza y así seguir dando mejor atención y atraer más clientela para que su negocio siga fortaleciéndose. Gracias a su esfuerzo diario y a KIVA por la confianza brindada, su hija mayor está estudiando y su sueño es verla una profesional.
texts.en: Carmen lives in the city of Santo Domingo, a place in the coastal region. She is a 36 year old woman, a single mother who shares her life with her two young daughters. Carmen is a very hardworking mother. Currently, she has a small sewing shop which is well located. She comments that it was not easy. She had to get experience by studying and also working in shops in the city. She had to sacrifice time of not being with her daughters in order to go to work and support her household. Little by little, Carmen was able to save, and because of it she is happy because from her home she is able to continue generating income. She has her shop with three sewing machines; and what is more important is that she has her daughters next to her where she can share with them. Carmen is a member of the institution. With her first loan she bought more fabrics and a used sewing machine. Now, she wants to keep on growing and increasing her business. She will buy another machine which is fundamental for her daily work, since it is indispensable to work faster with the clothes she sews and in this way keep on giving better service and attract more customers so that her business keeps on getting stronger. Thanks to her daily effort and to the trust given by KIVA, her older daughter is studying, and her dream is to see her become professional.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine in order to attract more customers and to have her business keep getting stronger.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro con 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto comerciales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Teodoro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Teodoro es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 47 years old and lives with his partner and four children in his own house made of rustic material. It is located in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaen, in the departmet of Cajamarca in Peru. He has many great references both business and labour, from the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the citizens in the local area work in agriculture, business and cattle breeding.

Teodoro earns a living through farming, specifically growing coffee, and he has had six years of experience in the field. The loan the he will be given is for use in agriculture, applying and incorporating pesticides, fertilisers and workers for the harvest. This will help him to improve his harvest physiologically, morphologically and productively. As well as a timely harvest, he hopes to increase production and quality of the product, so that he will not have any problems selling his product.

Teodoro is a repeat customer with Edpyme Alternative. He cosigns the loan with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural costs, applying and incorporating pesticides, fertilisers and workers for the harvest.

loans.name: Lucy Del Milagro

texts.es: Lucy es una joven de 22 años de edad soltera madre de un hijo pequeño, estudia la carrera de enfermería le parece muy interesante esta carrera ya que le permite ayudar a las personas que mas la necesitan al terminar la carrera desea estudiar licenciatura el dinero que solicitó lo utilizará para el pago de mensualidades de la universidad Lucy se siente contenta por que esta logrando cumplir su meta y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo,Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la confianza depositada en ella y desea que ayuden a jóvenes emprendedores que desean salir adelante.
texts.en: Lucy is a 22 year old young woman. She is a single mother of a small son. She is studying the career of nursing. She thinks this is a very interesting career, because it allows her to help the people who need it the most. When she finishes her career she wants to get a bachelor's degree. She requested a loan that she will use to pay for the monthly college tuition fees. Lucy feels happy, because she is achieving her goal and giving her son a better quality of life. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the trust they have given her, and she wants them to help young enterprising people who want to move ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the monthly college tuition fees.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Akouvi  est une femme âgée de 35 ans résidant à Baguida. Akouvi est une marchande  de médicaments traditionnel qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et les revendent en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Akouvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de racines aides mémoire, des racines antibiotique et des racines de traitement des faiblesses sexuelle en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 35-year old married woman and the mother of four who lives in Baguida. Akouvi sells traditional medications, stocking up once a month at the market and reselling as an itinerant vendor.
